programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents highlights of the Premier League fixture between Norwich City and Burnley at Carrow Road.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Arsenal v Manchester City. Action from the opening semi-final at Wembley Stadium, where the teams battled for a place in the final. The Citizens came out on top in this season's Premier League encounters between the teams, winning 3-0 on both occasions, most recently on 17 June as football returned to action after the lockdown.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 10.00.(n)

programme.title: Politics England
programme.desc: The latest political news and debate from a regional perspective.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Sally Phillips take a look at the week's talking points and explore the ethical and religious issues of the day.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Lynne Donnelly wants to move to Australia, so she takes her family for a trial week in Melbourne in the hope of convincing them to leave their home in Scotland for good.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: David Harper and Charles Hanson are in Oswestry, Shropshire, to help two teams look for items, while host Natasha Raskin Sharp has advice on collectibles from occupied Japan.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley finds out about the vicars of Eyam, Derbyshire, who initiated a lockdown 355 years ago to protect the rest of northern England from the bubonic plague.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore returns to transform more items reclaimed from a tip, beginning by rescuing a granite worktop from Altrincham Recycling Centre in Greater Manchester.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: The third part of a look back at the Games, focusing on the second half of the Games - a hectic eight days in which the British gold rush continued in east London.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin goes property hunting with a couple of new grandparents who have £800,000 to buy a home in Wiltshire close to their family. The presenter also takes time out to learn about the traditional process of curing Wiltshire bacon.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison and Tom Heap are in the Shropshire Hills to find out about an ambitious project to create a nature corridor between the two peaks of Long Mynd and Stiperstones. Tom meets a farmer who's become a convert to environmentally friendly regenerative farming, while Ellie goes in search of rare and much misunderstood wildlife. Charlotte Smith tests the strength of Britain's food supply system in the wake of the pandemic and with Brexit on the horizon.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester United v Chelsea (Kick-off 6.00pm). Gary Lineker presents all the action from the last-four match at Wembley Stadium. The sides last met here in the final of this competition two years ago, when Chelsea prevailed 1-0 courtesy of an Eden Hazard penalty. However, United are unbeaten in the six meetings between the clubs in all competitions and have defeated the Blues three times this season, completing a double over them in the league and winning at Stamford Bridge in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the historic Buckfast Abbey in Devon, where experts examine an 18th-century tankard, an iron chest with a hidden lock dating back to the 1640s, London street signs, a Biba frock, and a piece of shrapnel from the battleship Bismarck.(n)

programme.title: The Luminaries
programme.sub-title: The Old Moon in the Young Moon's Arms
programme.desc: Anna is tried for murder, but Emery is still missing - along with her alibi - and Moody refuses to act on her behalf as he believes the case to be indefensible. However, due to a mix-up the lawyer ends up with Lauderback's trunk and discovers a series of letters from Crosbie that reveal a startling fact. Lydia hosts a seance to make contact with Emery, intending to implicate Anna further, but instead she channels the spirit of Sook and inadvertently accuses Carver of murder. Period drama, starring Eva Green.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, featuring Bournemouth v Southampton at the Vitality Stadium and Tottenham Hotspur v Leicester City at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Looking for Alaska
programme.sub-title: They Couldn't Hit an Elephant from This Distance - General Sedgwick
programme.desc: A truce with the Weekday Warriors proves short-lived, Alaska sets Miles up on his very first date at the school's basketball game, and Takumi has a suspicion who the rat might be.(n)

programme.title: Looking for Alaska
programme.sub-title: The Nourishment Is Palatable - Millard Fillmore
programme.desc: Miles agrees to spend Thanksgiving with Alaska, but a trip to the Colonel's home for the holiday that was designed to bring everyone together only leaves the group further apart.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: The return of the programme offering advice about which foods are healthy or harmful. Chris Bavin investigates worrying reports that eating chicken and turkey could cause cancer, and Gloria Hunniford looks at the trend for feeding pets raw meat.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the development of a semi in Mottingham in south-east London, a detached in Littleover, Derby and a terrace in Dover in Kent.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Nick Knowles introduces footage of near misses caught on CCTV, including a couple out walking along the pavement who were hit by an out-of-control car.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Steph Connell and Thomas Forrester help teams look for items at Nottingham racecourse, while presenter Anita Manning gets to the bottom of a local UFO sighting.(n)

programme.title: The Heights
programme.desc: Death reunites the residents once again, but some relationships are beyond repair, while Sabine pulls an outrageous stunt. Australian drama, starring Bridie McKim.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps an Anglo-Icelandic couple, who need to relocate from Reykjavik to Aberdeenshire on their £380,000 budget before their daughter starts university in the region.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A fibre artist, a ceramicist and an abstract painter create artworks for a Staffordshire who woman wants a piece to mark the birth of her first grandchild. Nick Knowles presents.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: With the help of archive, Jay Blades charts how three inventions fixed in the barn - a magic lantern, projector and mutoscope - helped influence modern TV and film technology.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Rylan Clark-Neal present the first visit of the week to the studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The World Health Organisation urged countries to stamp out infections as soon as they developed, but the UK government's initial scientific advice said the route out of the crisis was for most of us to catch the virus so we could develop 'herd immunity'. Dr Faye Kirkland investigates this approach to the Covid-19 pandemic, asking whether it was a dangerous gamble with people's lives or a sound scientific method. Faced with a growing backlash and warnings that the NHS was close to being overwhelmed, politicians denied herd immunity was the policy and within a few days Britain pivoted to a new strategy - lockdown.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders: Secrets from the Square
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley is joined by Diane Parish and Tameka Empson, aka sisters Denise and Kim Fox, for a socially-distanced reunion as Tameka returns to set for the first time since 2019. The pair reveal all about their close working relationship and tell the stories behind some of their biggest moments - from Tameka reliving her infamous live labour scenes for the show's 30th anniversary to Diane explaining why she once had to pretend to all her friends and family that she'd quit the soap.(n)

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.sub-title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Cash-strapped Alison and Mike think all their problems have been solved when they inherit a grand country house, unaware that it is falling apart and teeming with the ghosts of former inhabitants. The spooks must act immediately to halt the new owners' plans to turn the house into a hotel, but their attempts to scare them away fail miserably. Comedy, starring Mathew Baynton, Simon Farnaby, Martha Howe-Douglas, Jim Howick, Laurence Rickard, Ben Willbond, Charlotte Ritchie and Kiell Smith-Bynoe.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets She Keeps
programme.desc: Agatha and Hayden attend an emotional vigil for missing baby Ben, while Megan and Jack's relationship is deteriorating under the strain. Agatha begins to panic when she realises that 'Rory' is becoming seriously unwell, but she is unwilling to seek medical help..(n)

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: Simon brings in a friend to try to convince his two stars to put their faith in him, while Michael worries about a neighbour when he spots an ambulance outside next door. David not only manages to keep the house in order and the home-schooling ticking over in Georgia's absence, but also gets around to finishing a draft of his screenplay.(n)

programme.title: Enterprice
programme.desc: The two business partners head out on a double date, with Kazim the one in love and Jeremiah his reluctant wingman. Out of their comfort zone, they head to the East End to meet the girls, but what follows is a very strange dinner - which goes from bad to worse very quickly. Return of the comedy, starring Kayode Ewumi and Trieve Blackwood-Cambridge.(n)

programme.title: Canada's Drag Race
programme.desc: Deborah Cox hosts as the contestants do battle in a song-and-dance diss-track showdown, with judges Brooke Lynn Hytes, Jeffrey Bowyer-Chapman and Stacey McKenzie.(n)

programme.title: Peter Crouch: Save Our Summer
programme.desc: The former footballer hosts a variety entertainment show, featuring live music, comedy skits and a host of celebrity guests via video links. Peter will also be joined in each episode by TV and BBC Radio 1 presenter Maya Jama, as well as Taskmaster's Alex Horne and his comedy band the Horne Section. This time, Mo Gilligan and Anne-Marie pop by for a chat and a game of Musical VAR, and Jamie Redknapp takes on Dina Asher-Smith in The Sporting Fix. Plus, Zara Larsson performs in The Garden Sessions.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: Chris Bavin and Gloria Hunniford are joined by Edwina Currie as they examine conflicting media stories about the safety of eating eggs, 30 years on from the salmonella scandal.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A large terraced house in Earlsfield in London, ancient woodland in Eythorne in Kent, and a building housing six flats in Tonypandy in Glamorgan are all sold at auction.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A Coastguard crew fights to save a film extra who is taken ill at the top of a cathedral tower, and customers at a pub run from an out-of-control lorry. Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Ochuko Ojiri and Jonathan Pratt help two teams scour an antiques fair at the National Botanic Garden of Wales in Carmarthenshire, while presenter Eric Knowles visits a rugby union club to see a collection of sporting footwear memorabilia.(n)

programme.title: The Heights
programme.desc: Time together is revealing for Ana and Ryan, and also for Renee and Mark. Kam faces a tough interview.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin meets a couple of creative Californians keen to make a lifestyle leap to the Welsh borders, and also discovers how llamas are thriving in the British countryside.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Nick Knowles challenges an impressionist painter, a metal sculptor and an artist who paints in a caravan to create artwork for a London couple who have just renovated their home.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades revisits three fixes from the barn - a polyphon, gramophone and transistor radio - to tell the story of how modern music has been influenced by vintage music players.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Rylan Clark-Neal present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: In an episode originally broadcast on 27 October 1998, Pat and Peggy clash spectacularly following an accusation that Frank and Pat are having an affair behind their partners' backs. Frank searches for a missing Roy.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Kian returns to Darwin Ward, determined to make amends with Jac. But when forgiveness does not come easy, Kian goes into self-destruct mode - with almost fatal consequences. Meanwhile, a broken Essie searches for her purpose, but where will she find the answer she seeks? Ric suspects Guy has fallen off the wagon and sets out to stop him working at Holby, once and for all.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets She Keeps
programme.desc: With no money and Rory's health faltering, Agatha finds refuge in the storeroom of her old workplace. Meghan and Jack are at breaking point until Agatha takes a phone call from Hayden, who is in police custody. Laura Carmichael stars.(n)

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: In the final episode, the play's producer decides to draft in a voice of experience to get Michael and David in line. Meanwhile, Georgia shares David's work without him knowing, and he is pleasantly surprised by the enthusiastic response his work receives, and Michael seeks resolution on what has happened to his neighbour. Comedy, starring Michael Sheen and David Tennant.(n)

programme.title: How's Your Head, Hun
programme.sub-title: How's Your Head, Hun? with Michelle Visage
programme.desc: Michelle Visage welcomes comedian Keith Lemon, who chats about the appeal of crafting in a pandemic. Former footballer Alex Scott rings to inspire Michelle with her ambitious workouts, and the presenter gets on a treadmill with bestie Leah Remini.(n)

programme.title: Hayley Goes..
programme.desc: Hayley Pearce is proud of her working-class roots, but with the gap between rich and poor widening, she wants to know how easy it would be for her to move up a class. She overhauls her leisure activities with a spot of golf and some classical music, takes voice lessons to refine her accent and supercharges her table manners with an intense etiquette lesson. However, she soon discovers that there are obstacles in the way that can make social mobility very difficult.(n)

programme.title: Ambulance - Liverpool
programme.desc: Award-winning documentary following the North West Ambulance Service as they care for the people of Liverpool and all across Merseyside. The control room experiences a spike in calls for patients with breathing difficulties, and when Sherilee talks to a daughter calls whose mother has chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, it proves tough for the call handler as her own mum had the same illness. Meanwhile, call handler Brogan has to guide a caller through lifesaving CPR while they wait for an ambulance, and there's a full emergency at John Lennon Airport when a plane loses contact with air traffic control.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford finds out if drinking cups of tea can increase the risk of cancer, and Danny Crates skips breakfast for a week to see if it helps with weight loss.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The presenters follow the development of a semi-detached house in Romford, Essex, a four-bedroom terrace in Liverpool and a former bank in Nuneaton in Warwickshire.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Footage captures the moment a van teeters on the edge of a motorway bridge after skidding on black ice, and the adventurous pensioner who got lost on Ben Nevis during a snow storm.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian and David Harper guide two teams scouring Nottingham racecourse for bargains to take to auction. Presented by Natasha Raskin Sharp.(n)

programme.title: The Heights
programme.desc: Fresh starts are considered in some households, while Leonie's legal skills find an outlet. Australian drama, starring Fiona Press.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is in Dorset to help a couple with £475,000 find a rural property that fits the bill when it comes to a workshop and providing space to keep hens. Jules also delves in the county's glove-making heritage and produces his own bespoke pair.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Artists create pieces for buyers in Chesterfield who want something special to remember their beloved fathers and stepdad, who they tragically lost in the space of two years.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades traces heroic stories from the Second World War and how they still resonate today, revisiting three fixes from the barn; a watch, swagger stick and belt.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio. Presented by Alex Jones and Rylan Clark-Neal.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and the Rich brothers are in Wallasey to turn Sue's concrete space into a garden fitting for the two rose bushes she planted for her late husband and mother.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jonathan Owen from Sussex arrives at the barn, bearing a small item with a big history for the attention of woodwork specialist Will Kirk. The prized possession is a hand-made model Spitfire plane, carved by Jonathan's Uncle Reggie between bombing raids over Germany. Master saddlemaker Suzie Fletcher tackles the repair of a worn out and badly torn leather pouffe with precious memories for its owner Lou, silversmith Brenton West takes on the restoration of a battered silver purse and mechanical guru Steve Fletcher is faced with how to carry out the delicate repair of an old Victorian rain gauge.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The last group of five well-known faces, tennis coach Judy Murray, broadcaster and internet personality Riyadh Khalaf, Olympic gold medallist and sports presenter Sir Matthew Pinsent CBE, TV personality Pete Wicks, and actor and comedian Crissy Rock, enter the MasterChef kitchen to take on a series of culinary challenges. Crissy, Sir Matthew and Pete head to Sam's Riverside, while Judy and Riyadh go to Scully to cook for paying customers in a busy lunch service, before the contestants head back to the MasterChef kitchen to impress judges John and Gregg with their own creations.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester United v West Ham United, at Old Trafford, Liverpool v Chelsea at Anfield and Aston Villa v Arsenal at Villa Park.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Welsh international footballer Hal Robson-Kanu, British athletics great Colin Jackson, rugby league legend Paul Sculthorpe and world champion boxer Terri Harper join regular team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell and host Sue Barker on the quiz.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford finds out if a daily glass of wine is a good thing and Chris Bavin asks if calorie counting is a sensible approach to weight loss.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell visit a terraced house in Wigston, Leicestershire, a flat in Swanscombe, Kent, and a piece of land in Bolton, Lancashire.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Near misses caught on CCTV, including a woman trapped in her loft conversion while a fire rages below her and the race to rescue a boy who has fallen off a promenade into the sea.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Tim Weeks provide expert advice to two teams as the competition heads to the Royal Cornwall Showground in Wadebridge. Presenter Anita Manning shows of a Bargain Hunt favourite with a Cornish flavour.(n)

programme.title: The Heights
programme.desc: Impending changes come hard for Ryan, Renee, Hazel and Shannon. A letter for Kam sparks excitement.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple look for a home in Derbyshire on a budget of £450,000, and also visits the Royal Crown Derby factory to find out about the porcelain industry.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A stone carver, a fine art painter and a heraldic artist pitch ideas for a piece of art to celebrate the 850th anniversary of a Scottish castle. Hosted by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: The repairs of a cash register, a camera and a calculator, three pre-digital items that helped shape the modern computerised world people take for granted today.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Rylan Clark-Neal present the magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood and Michelle Ackerley investigate counterfeit buffalo mozzarella being sold on supermarket pizzas, and potentially dangerous hairdryers. They also tell the story of a website racket that robbed people of millions of pounds, and Michelle finds out what's real and what's fake in the world of celebrity memorabilia.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining four celebrities face two more challenges, beginning with the pairs task. Here they are split into teams and have to each serve up either John Torode's sushi selection or his veal schnitzel with spaetzle - all while separated by a wall. The second challenge sees them entering the world of mass catering at Leyton Orient Football Club.(n)

programme.title: Dear NHS Superstars
programme.desc: A selection of personal stories from some of Britain's best-loved stars paying tribute to the work of the NHS. Amanda Holden, Lenny Henry, Jo Brand and Alex Brooker are among the famous faces sharing their admiration for healthcare staff who have touched their lives in all sorts of ways. Others expressing their gratitude include Jack Whitehall, Adrian Lester, Shirley Ballas, Phil Wang, Rosie Jones, Kevin Bridges, Konnie Huq, Sue Perkins and Mel Giedroyc. Presented by writer, comedian and former doctor Adam Kay.(n)

programme.title: Imagine
programme.sub-title: Imagine: Lemn Sissay - The Memory of Me
programme.desc: Alan Yentob talks to the poet and playwright, who recently published his memoir My Name Is Why. He discusses what it was like growing up as the only black child in a sleepy market town outside Wigan in the 1970s, his time in care and how he was separated from his foster family at the age of 12 and left to fend for himself. He also returns to Ethiopia to find out more about his roots. Featuring contributions from colleagues including Steve Coogan, Benjamin Zephaniah, Linton Kwesi Johnson and Julie Hesmondhalgh.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: UCOS looks into the murder of a private investigator who was stabbed through the heart in a suspected robbery gone wrong. The answers may lie with the victim's last three cases, but it'll take the whole team's expertise to crack the codes within his mysterious notebook. The movements of a rare stamp could hold the key to the investigation - if only UCOS could track it down. Meanwhile, Steve has problems when he rents out his flat.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: Chris Bavin takes a look at claims that diet drinks could be making people gain weight, Gloria Hunniford finds out whether all carbs should be avoided or if some are the key to a healthy lifestyle and Danny Crates looks at whether greasy and sugary foods affect people's skin.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Martell Maxwell and Dion Dublin visit a terrace house in Stourbridge in the West Midlands, and in Greater Manchester a terrace house in Alkrington and a semi in Wigan. After each is auctioned, they talk to the buyers about their money-making plans.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Footage of near misses caught on CCTV. An experienced base jumper's parachute gets tangled up when he leaps off Beachy Head, passers by come to the aid of a fitness trainer collapsed in the street, and a fire near a petrol station causes staff and customers to run for safety. Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Caroline Hawley and Roo Irvine help two teams look for items in the Lancashire town of Eccleston, with Eric Knowles overseeing proceedings.(n)

programme.title: The Heights
programme.desc: The future looks uncertain for some when money becomes a stumbling block, and a revelation rocks one family. Australian drama, starring Fiona Press.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor helps a couple with a £500,000 budget find a character property with space for entertaining and a baby grand piano, as well as an outdoor setting to keep a keen gardener busy. Along the way, the presenter heads out to the oyster beds of Poole harbour to discover more about how they are farmed and harvested sustainably to meet popular demand..(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Three artists head to Chester, where the buyer wants something to mark her 10th year of singing in an award-winning ladies choir. With £500 on offer, will it be a glass maker who works on a barge, a collage artist who re-works magazines, or a textile worker of wool who makes the buyer's day? Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades examines the evolution of modern-day transport through archive footage and revisiting three repairs from the barn - a Penny Farthing bike, a tram seat and a speedometer.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Rylan Clark-Neal round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Manchester City winger Shaun Wright-Phillips, 1992 Olympic 400m hurdles champion Sally Gunnell, seven-time world snooker champion Stephen Hendry, and 2016 Olympic silver medal-winning swimmer Jazz Carlin join regular team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell and host Sue Barker on the quiz.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Chef and restaurateur John Torode and food writer and ingredients expert Gregg Wallace judge the efforts of four contenders battling for the last two places in the semi-finals, tasking them to cook a faultless two-course meal. Lending their thoughts on proceedings are three legends of the series - former champion Angellica Bell and finalists Les Dennis and Spencer Matthews. They know exactly what it takes to get through this competition and are almost certainly in for a treat as the contenders strive to remain in the reckoning.(n)

programme.title: Jack Whitehall's Sporting Nation
programme.desc: Jack continues to take a light-hearted and nostalgia-filled look back at Britain's sporting history, telling the nation's story through its most iconic moments and characters. In this third edition, he takes a comedic sprint through British sport's greatest underdog moments, from Leicester City's incredible Premier League win in 2016 and Kelly Holmes' double Olympic triumph in 2004, to a certain Northern Irish snooker player with odd-looking glasses whose World Championship victory gripped the nation in 1985.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: John enlists the help of his Nan to reluctantly wait in for a parcel delivery, while Kayleigh wants to know where she stands with her colleague. Will they finally get together, or will his daydreaming soul mate look for a lift elsewhere? Sitcom, co-written by and starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson.(n)

programme.title: The Young Offenders
programme.desc: With the arrival of baby Star, Jock struggles with his parental skills. Billy Murphy, meanwhile, comes up with a masterplan to carry out a heist to steal a consignment of high definition televisions and involves both Jock and Conor. However, drafting in young Star causes chaos. Comedy, starring Chris Walley, Alex Murphy and Shane Casey.(n)

programme.title: The Shining
programme.desc: An aspiring writer takes a caretaking job at a remote mountain hotel. It has closed for the winter, and he has been hired to get the place ready for the next season. But evil spirits haunting its corridors destroy his sanity, causing the unhinged author to rampage through the hotel and terrorise his wife and young son. Stanley Kubrick's horror, based on the Stephen King novel, with Jack Nicholson, Shelley Duvall, Danny Lloyd and Scatman Crothers.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Highlights from throughout the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Nick Nairn and Dougie Vipond focus on plant-based food, cooking a Buddha-Bowl with onion bhajis, with vegetable grower Bryde Marshall and actress Jane McCarry.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker, Alex Scott and Tim Cahill look ahead to the final round of Premier League fixtures, which include West Ham United v Aston Villa and Leicester City v Manchester United.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: Clare Balding and Gabby Logan look back at some of the most memorable moments by British athletes at Olympic Games, counting down the top 25 moments from Britain's Summer Olympics. Some of the highlights expected to feature are the battle between Seb Coe and Steve Cram in the 1500m at Los Angeles 1984, where Daley Thompson also made headlines in the Decathlon. Steve Redgrave's attempt to claim a fifth rowing gold medal at Sydney 2000 is sure to be high up the list, as are Linford Christie and Sally Gunnell's exploits in the men's 100m and women's 400m hurdles at Barcelona 1992. London 2012 saw Team GB claim a record number of gold medals, with sporting luminaries such as Bradley Wiggins, Jessica Ennis-Hill, Andy Murray and Mo Farah proving why they were household names, and new stars such as Nicola Adams, Laura Trott and Anthony Joshua burst onto the sporting landscape.(n)

programme.title: The Farmer's Llamas
programme.desc: When the Farmer and Bitzer go to a country fair, Shaun the Sheep steals away with them intent on causing mischief. He spies an auction where he sees three exotic and very crafty llamas going under the hammer. Instantly impressed by their amusing pranks, Shaun sneakily gets the Farmer to buy them, but it's not long before these cheeky newcomers wreak havoc. Animated fun, with the voice of Justin Fletcher.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys asks the questions as four more famous faces take to the black chair, with participants donating their fee to their chosen charities. Comedian Paul Chuckle, actress Amanda Henderson, comic and writer Geoff Norcott and chef and entrepreneur Levi Roots tackle questions on English football clubs, songs from animated Disney films, the Star Wars prequel trilogy and reggae music.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a special Olympics edition of the general knowledge quiz, featuring Anthony Ogogo, Helen Glover, Sir Matthew Pinsent, James Cracknell, Nick Skelton, JJ Chalmers, Jeanette Kwakye and Mark Foster.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: With Lev acting distant, Faith struggles to cope whilst waiting for the results of Luka's latest scan. In a crisis, she calls Dylan, asking to see a friendly face, and he agrees to be there to support her. Meanwhile, Ethan bumps into Fenisha at Holby Comic Con and the pair are delighted to see each other. However, things soon turn awry when a van is accidently driven into a merchandise stall, seriously injuring several people, and Ethan is suddenly struck by terrifying memories of last year's terrorist attack.(n)

programme.title: Peter Crouch: Save Our Summer
programme.desc: The former footballer hosts a variety entertainment show, featuring live music, comedy skits and a host of celebrity guests via video links. Peter will also be joined in each episode by TV and BBC Radio 1 presenter Maya Jama, as well as Taskmaster's Alex Horne and his comedy band the Horne Section. In the final episode of the series, Jamie Redknapp and Mo Farah go head to head in a spectacular Sporting Fix finale, and there is an extra special footballing legends edition of Musical VAR. Plus, AJ Tracey and Mabel give an exclusive performance in The Garden Sessions.(n)

programme.title: Iron Man 3
programme.desc: The armoured avenger hunts for the mastermind behind an untraceable series of bombings, despite being cut off from his usual resources and traumatised by a recent brush with death. His search uncovers a secret conspiracy involving a drug that renders the user indestructible. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Gwyneth Paltrow and Don Cheadle.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents highlights of the Premier League fixture between Norwich City and Burnley at Carrow Road.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Arsenal v Manchester City. Action from the opening semi-final at Wembley Stadium, where the teams battled for a place in the final. The Citizens came out on top in this season's Premier League encounters between the teams, winning 3-0 on both occasions, most recently on 17 June as football returned to action after the lockdown.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 10.00.(n)

programme.desc: Lynne Donnelly wants to move to Australia, so she takes her family for a trial week in Melbourne in the hope of convincing them to leave their home in Scotland for good.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley finds out about the vicars of Eyam, Derbyshire, who initiated a lockdown 355 years ago to protect the rest of northern England from the bubonic plague.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: The third part of a look back at the Games, focusing on the second half of the Games - a hectic eight days in which the British gold rush continued in east London.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin goes property hunting with a couple of new grandparents who have £800,000 to buy a home in Wiltshire close to their family. The presenter also takes time out to learn about the traditional process of curing Wiltshire bacon.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison and Tom Heap are in the Shropshire Hills to find out about an ambitious project to create a nature corridor between the two peaks of Long Mynd and Stiperstones. Tom meets a farmer who's become a convert to environmentally friendly regenerative farming, while Ellie goes in search of rare and much misunderstood wildlife. Charlotte Smith tests the strength of Britain's food supply system in the wake of the pandemic and with Brexit on the horizon.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester United v Chelsea (Kick-off 6.00pm). Gary Lineker presents all the action from the last-four match at Wembley Stadium. The sides last met here in the final of this competition two years ago, when Chelsea prevailed 1-0 courtesy of an Eden Hazard penalty. However, United are unbeaten in the six meetings between the clubs in all competitions and have defeated the Blues three times this season, completing a double over them in the league and winning at Stamford Bridge in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the historic Buckfast Abbey in Devon, where experts examine an 18th-century tankard, an iron chest with a hidden lock dating back to the 1640s, London street signs, a Biba frock, and a piece of shrapnel from the battleship Bismarck.(n)

programme.title: The Luminaries
programme.sub-title: The Old Moon in the Young Moon's Arms
programme.desc: Anna is tried for murder, but Emery is still missing - along with her alibi - and Moody refuses to act on her behalf as he believes the case to be indefensible. However, due to a mix-up the lawyer ends up with Lauderback's trunk and discovers a series of letters from Crosbie that reveal a startling fact. Lydia hosts a seance to make contact with Emery, intending to implicate Anna further, but instead she channels the spirit of Sook and inadvertently accuses Carver of murder. Period drama, starring Eva Green.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, featuring Bournemouth v Southampton at the Vitality Stadium and Tottenham Hotspur v Leicester City at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Looking for Alaska
programme.sub-title: They Couldn't Hit an Elephant from This Distance - General Sedgwick
programme.desc: A truce with the Weekday Warriors proves short-lived, Alaska sets Miles up on his very first date at the school's basketball game, and Takumi has a suspicion who the rat might be.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Nourishment Is Palatable - Millard Fillmore
programme.desc: Miles agrees to spend Thanksgiving with Alaska, but a trip to the Colonel's home for the holiday that was designed to bring everyone together only leaves the group further apart.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The World Health Organisation urged countries to stamp out infections as soon as they developed, but the UK government's initial scientific advice said the route out of the crisis was for most of us to catch the virus so we could develop 'herd immunity'. Dr Faye Kirkland investigates this approach to the Covid-19 pandemic, asking whether it was a dangerous gamble with people's lives or a sound scientific method. Faced with a growing backlash and warnings that the NHS was close to being overwhelmed, politicians denied herd immunity was the policy and within a few days Britain pivoted to a new strategy - lockdown.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders: Secrets from the Square
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley is joined by Diane Parish and Tameka Empson, aka sisters Denise and Kim Fox, for a socially-distanced reunion as Tameka returns to set for the first time since 2019. The pair reveal all about their close working relationship and tell the stories behind some of their biggest moments - from Tameka reliving her infamous live labour scenes for the show's 30th anniversary to Diane explaining why she once had to pretend to all her friends and family that she'd quit the soap.(n)

programme.sub-title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Cash-strapped Alison and Mike think all their problems have been solved when they inherit a grand country house, unaware that it is falling apart and teeming with the ghosts of former inhabitants. The spooks must act immediately to halt the new owners' plans to turn the house into a hotel, but their attempts to scare them away fail miserably. Comedy, starring Mathew Baynton, Simon Farnaby, Martha Howe-Douglas, Jim Howick, Laurence Rickard, Ben Willbond, Charlotte Ritchie and Kiell Smith-Bynoe.(n)

programme.desc: Agatha and Hayden attend an emotional vigil for missing baby Ben, while Megan and Jack's relationship is deteriorating under the strain. Agatha begins to panic when she realises that 'Rory' is becoming seriously unwell, but she is unwilling to seek medical help..(n)

programme.desc: The two business partners head out on a double date, with Kazim the one in love and Jeremiah his reluctant wingman. Out of their comfort zone, they head to the East End to meet the girls, but what follows is a very strange dinner - which goes from bad to worse very quickly. Return of the comedy, starring Kayode Ewumi and Trieve Blackwood-Cambridge.(n)

programme.desc: Alex Jones and Rylan Clark-Neal present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat.(n)

programme.desc: In an episode originally broadcast on 27 October 1998, Pat and Peggy clash spectacularly following an accusation that Frank and Pat are having an affair behind their partners' backs. Frank searches for a missing Roy.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Kian returns to Darwin Ward, determined to make amends with Jac. But when forgiveness does not come easy, Kian goes into self-destruct mode - with almost fatal consequences. Meanwhile, a broken Essie searches for her purpose, but where will she find the answer she seeks? Ric suspects Guy has fallen off the wagon and sets out to stop him working at Holby, once and for all.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets She Keeps
programme.desc: With no money and Rory's health faltering, Agatha finds refuge in the storeroom of her old workplace. Meghan and Jack are at breaking point until Agatha takes a phone call from Hayden, who is in police custody. Laura Carmichael stars.(n)

programme.desc: In the final episode, the play's producer decides to draft in a voice of experience to get Michael and David in line. Meanwhile, Georgia shares David's work without him knowing, and he is pleasantly surprised by the enthusiastic response his work receives, and Michael seeks resolution on what has happened to his neighbour. Comedy, starring Michael Sheen and David Tennant.(n)

programme.title: How's Your Head, Hun
programme.sub-title: How's Your Head, Hun? with Michelle Visage
programme.desc: Michelle Visage welcomes comedian Keith Lemon, who chats about the appeal of crafting in a pandemic. Former footballer Alex Scott rings to inspire Michelle with her ambitious workouts, and the presenter gets on a treadmill with bestie Leah Remini.(n)

programme.desc: Hayley Pearce is proud of her working-class roots, but with the gap between rich and poor widening, she wants to know how easy it would be for her to move up a class. She overhauls her leisure activities with a spot of golf and some classical music, takes voice lessons to refine her accent and supercharges her table manners with an intense etiquette lesson. However, she soon discovers that there are obstacles in the way that can make social mobility very difficult.(n)

programme.title: Ambulance - Liverpool
programme.desc: Award-winning documentary following the North West Ambulance Service as they care for the people of Liverpool and all across Merseyside. The control room experiences a spike in calls for patients with breathing difficulties, and when Sherilee talks to a daughter calls whose mother has chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, it proves tough for the call handler as her own mum had the same illness. Meanwhile, call handler Brogan has to guide a caller through lifesaving CPR while they wait for an ambulance, and there's a full emergency at John Lennon Airport when a plane loses contact with air traffic control.(n)

programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and the Rich brothers are in Wallasey to turn Sue's concrete space into a garden fitting for the two rose bushes she planted for her late husband and mother.(n)

programme.desc: Jonathan Owen from Sussex arrives at the barn, bearing a small item with a big history for the attention of woodwork specialist Will Kirk. The prized possession is a hand-made model Spitfire plane, carved by Jonathan's Uncle Reggie between bombing raids over Germany. Master saddlemaker Suzie Fletcher tackles the repair of a worn out and badly torn leather pouffe with precious memories for its owner Lou, silversmith Brenton West takes on the restoration of a battered silver purse and mechanical guru Steve Fletcher is faced with how to carry out the delicate repair of an old Victorian rain gauge.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The last group of five well-known faces, tennis coach Judy Murray, broadcaster and internet personality Riyadh Khalaf, Olympic gold medallist and sports presenter Sir Matthew Pinsent CBE, TV personality Pete Wicks, and actor and comedian Crissy Rock, enter the MasterChef kitchen to take on a series of culinary challenges. Crissy, Sir Matthew and Pete head to Sam's Riverside, while Judy and Riyadh go to Scully to cook for paying customers in a busy lunch service, before the contestants head back to the MasterChef kitchen to impress judges John and Gregg with their own creations.(n)

They also tell the story of a website racket that robbed people of millions of pounds, and Michelle finds out what's real and what's fake in the world of celebrity memorabilia.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining four celebrities face two more challenges, beginning with the pairs task. Here they are split into teams and have to each serve up either John Torode's sushi selection or his veal schnitzel with spaetzle - all while separated by a wall. The second challenge sees them entering the world of mass catering at Leyton Orient Football Club.(n)

programme.title: Dear NHS Superstars
programme.desc: A selection of personal stories from some of Britain's best-loved stars paying tribute to the work of the NHS. Amanda Holden, Lenny Henry, Jo Brand and Alex Brooker are among the famous faces sharing their admiration for healthcare staff who have touched their lives in all sorts of ways. Others expressing their gratitude include Jack Whitehall, Adrian Lester, Shirley Ballas, Phil Wang, Rosie Jones, Kevin Bridges, Konnie Huq, Sue Perkins and Mel Giedroyc. Presented by writer, comedian and former doctor Adam Kay.(n)

programme.title: Imagine
programme.sub-title: Imagine: Lemn Sissay - The Memory of Me
programme.desc: Alan Yentob talks to the poet and playwright, who recently published his memoir My Name Is Why. He discusses what it was like growing up as the only black child in a sleepy market town outside Wigan in the 1970s, his time in care and how he was separated from his foster family at the age of 12 and left to fend for himself. He also returns to Ethiopia to find out more about his roots. Featuring contributions from colleagues including Steve Coogan, Benjamin Zephaniah, Linton Kwesi Johnson and Julie Hesmondhalgh.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: UCOS looks into the murder of a private investigator who was stabbed through the heart in a suspected robbery gone wrong. The answers may lie with the victim's last three cases, but it'll take the whole team's expertise to crack the codes within his mysterious notebook. The movements of a rare stamp could hold the key to the investigation - if only UCOS could track it down. Meanwhile, Steve has problems when he rents out his flat.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: Chris Bavin takes a look at claims that diet drinks could be making people gain weight, Gloria Hunniford finds out whether all carbs should be avoided or if some are the key to a healthy lifestyle and Danny Crates looks at whether greasy and sugary foods affect people's skin.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Martell Maxwell and Dion Dublin visit a terrace house in Stourbridge in the West Midlands, and in Greater Manchester a terrace house in Alkrington and a semi in Wigan. After each is auctioned, they talk to the buyers about their money-making plans.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Footage of near misses caught on CCTV. An experienced base jumper's parachute gets tangled up when he leaps off Beachy Head, passers by come to the aid of a fitness trainer collapsed in the street, and a fire near a petrol station causes staff and customers to run for safety. Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Caroline Hawley and Roo Irvine help two teams look for items in the Lancashire town of Eccleston, with Eric Knowles overseeing proceedings.(n)

programme.title: The Heights
programme.desc: The future looks uncertain for some when money becomes a stumbling block, and a revelation rocks one family. Australian drama, starring Fiona Press.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor helps a couple with a £500,000 budget find a character property with space for entertaining and a baby grand piano, as well as an outdoor setting to keep a keen gardener busy. Along the way, the presenter heads out to the oyster beds of Poole harbour to discover more about how they are farmed and harvested sustainably to meet popular demand..(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Three artists head to Chester, where the buyer wants something to mark her 10th year of singing in an award-winning ladies choir. With £500 on offer, will it be a glass maker who works on a barge, a collage artist who re-works magazines, or a textile worker of wool who makes the buyer's day? Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades examines the evolution of modern-day transport through archive footage and revisiting three repairs from the barn - a Penny Farthing bike, a tram seat and a speedometer.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Rylan Clark-Neal round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Manchester City winger Shaun Wright-Phillips, 1992 Olympic 400m hurdles champion Sally Gunnell, seven-time world snooker champion Stephen Hendry, and 2016 Olympic silver medal-winning swimmer Jazz Carlin join regular team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell and host Sue Barker on the quiz.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Chef and restaurateur John Torode and food writer and ingredients expert Gregg Wallace judge the efforts of four contenders battling for the last two places in the semi-finals, tasking them to cook a faultless two-course meal. Lending their thoughts on proceedings are three legends of the series - former champion Angellica Bell and finalists Les Dennis and Spencer Matthews. They know exactly what it takes to get through this competition and are almost certainly in for a treat as the contenders strive to remain in the reckoning.(n)

programme.title: Jack Whitehall's Sporting Nation
programme.desc: Jack continues to take a light-hearted and nostalgia-filled look back at Britain's sporting history, telling the nation's story through its most iconic moments and characters. In this third edition, he takes a comedic sprint through British sport's greatest underdog moments, from Leicester City's incredible Premier League win in 2016 and Kelly Holmes' double Olympic triumph in 2004, to a certain Northern Irish snooker player with odd-looking glasses whose World Championship victory gripped the nation in 1985.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: John enlists the help of his Nan to reluctantly wait in for a parcel delivery, while Kayleigh wants to know where she stands with her colleague. Will they finally get together, or will his daydreaming soul mate look for a lift elsewhere? Sitcom, co-written by and starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson.(n)

programme.title: The Young Offenders
programme.desc: With the arrival of baby Star, Jock struggles with his parental skills. Billy Murphy, meanwhile, comes up with a masterplan to carry out a heist to steal a consignment of high definition televisions and involves both Jock and Conor. However, drafting in young Star causes chaos. Comedy, starring Chris Walley, Alex Murphy and Shane Casey.(n)

programme.title: The Shining
programme.desc: An aspiring writer takes a caretaking job at a remote mountain hotel. It has closed for the winter, and he has been hired to get the place ready for the next season. But evil spirits haunting its corridors destroy his sanity, causing the unhinged author to rampage through the hotel and terrorise his wife and young son. Stanley Kubrick's horror, based on the Stephen King novel, with Jack Nicholson, Shelley Duvall, Danny Lloyd and Scatman Crothers.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Highlights from throughout the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Nick Nairn and Dougie Vipond focus on plant-based food, cooking a Buddha-Bowl with onion bhajis, with vegetable grower Bryde Marshall and actress Jane McCarry.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker, Alex Scott and Tim Cahill look ahead to the final round of Premier League fixtures, which include West Ham United v Aston Villa and Leicester City v Manchester United.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: Clare Balding and Gabby Logan look back at some of the most memorable moments by British athletes at Olympic Games, counting down the top 25 moments from Britain's Summer Olympics. Some of the highlights expected to feature are the battle between Seb Coe and Steve Cram in the 1500m at Los Angeles 1984, where Daley Thompson also made headlines in the Decathlon. Steve Redgrave's attempt to claim a fifth rowing gold medal at Sydney 2000 is sure to be high up the list, as are Linford Christie and Sally Gunnell's exploits in the men's 100m and women's 400m hurdles at Barcelona 1992. London 2012 saw Team GB claim a record number of gold medals, with sporting luminaries such as Bradley Wiggins, Jessica Ennis-Hill, Andy Murray and Mo Farah proving why they were household names, and new stars such as Nicola Adams, Laura Trott and Anthony Joshua burst onto the sporting landscape.(n)

programme.title: The Farmer's Llamas
programme.desc: When the Farmer and Bitzer go to a country fair, Shaun the Sheep steals away with them intent on causing mischief. He spies an auction where he sees three exotic and very crafty llamas going under the hammer. Instantly impressed by their amusing pranks, Shaun sneakily gets the Farmer to buy them, but it's not long before these cheeky newcomers wreak havoc. Animated fun, with the voice of Justin Fletcher.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys asks the questions as four more famous faces take to the black chair, with participants donating their fee to their chosen charities. Comedian Paul Chuckle, actress Amanda Henderson, comic and writer Geoff Norcott and chef and entrepreneur Levi Roots tackle questions on English football clubs, songs from animated Disney films, the Star Wars prequel trilogy and reggae music.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a special Olympics edition of the general knowledge quiz, featuring Anthony Ogogo, Helen Glover, Sir Matthew Pinsent, James Cracknell, Nick Skelton, JJ Chalmers, Jeanette Kwakye and Mark Foster.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: With Lev acting distant, Faith struggles to cope whilst waiting for the results of Luka's latest scan. In a crisis, she calls Dylan, asking to see a friendly face, and he agrees to be there to support her. Meanwhile, Ethan bumps into Fenisha at Holby Comic Con and the pair are delighted to see each other. However, things soon turn awry when a van is accidently driven into a merchandise stall, seriously injuring several people, and Ethan is suddenly struck by terrifying memories of last year's terrorist attack.(n)

programme.title: Peter Crouch: Save Our Summer
programme.desc: The former footballer hosts a variety entertainment show, featuring live music, comedy skits and a host of celebrity guests via video links. Peter will also be joined in each episode by TV and BBC Radio 1 presenter Maya Jama, as well as Taskmaster's Alex Horne and his comedy band the Horne Section. In the final episode of the series, Jamie Redknapp and Mo Farah go head to head in a spectacular Sporting Fix finale, and there is an extra special footballing legends edition of Musical VAR. Plus, AJ Tracey and Mabel give an exclusive performance in The Garden Sessions.(n)

programme.title: Iron Man 3
programme.desc: The armoured avenger hunts for the mastermind behind an untraceable series of bombings, despite being cut off from his usual resources and traumatised by a recent brush with death. His search uncovers a secret conspiracy involving a drug that renders the user indestructible. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Gwyneth Paltrow and Don Cheadle.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents highlights of the Premier League fixture between Norwich City and Burnley at Carrow Road.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Arsenal v Manchester City. Action from the opening semi-final at Wembley Stadium, where the teams battled for a place in the final. The Citizens came out on top in this season's Premier League encounters between the teams, winning 3-0 on both occasions, most recently on 17 June as football returned to action after the lockdown.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 10.00.(n)

programme.title: Politics England
programme.desc: The latest political news and debate from a regional perspective.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Sally Phillips take a look at the week's talking points and explore the ethical and religious issues of the day.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Lynne Donnelly wants to move to Australia, so she takes her family for a trial week in Melbourne in the hope of convincing them to leave their home in Scotland for good.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: David Harper and Charles Hanson are in Oswestry, Shropshire, to help two teams look for items, while host Natasha Raskin Sharp has advice on collectibles from occupied Japan.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley finds out about the vicars of Eyam, Derbyshire, who initiated a lockdown 355 years ago to protect the rest of northern England from the bubonic plague.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore returns to transform more items reclaimed from a tip, beginning by rescuing a granite worktop from Altrincham Recycling Centre in Greater Manchester.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: The third part of a look back at the Games, focusing on the second half of the Games - a hectic eight days in which the British gold rush continued in east London.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin goes property hunting with a couple of new grandparents who have £800,000 to buy a home in Wiltshire close to their family. The presenter also takes time out to learn about the traditional process of curing Wiltshire bacon.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison and Tom Heap are in the Shropshire Hills to find out about an ambitious project to create a nature corridor between the two peaks of Long Mynd and Stiperstones. Tom meets a farmer who's become a convert to environmentally friendly regenerative farming, while Ellie goes in search of rare and much misunderstood wildlife. Charlotte Smith tests the strength of Britain's food supply system in the wake of the pandemic and with Brexit on the horizon.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester United v Chelsea (Kick-off 6.00pm). Gary Lineker presents all the action from the last-four match at Wembley Stadium. The sides last met here in the final of this competition two years ago, when Chelsea prevailed 1-0 courtesy of an Eden Hazard penalty. However, United are unbeaten in the six meetings between the clubs in all competitions and have defeated the Blues three times this season, completing a double over them in the league and winning at Stamford Bridge in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the historic Buckfast Abbey in Devon, where experts examine an 18th-century tankard, an iron chest with a hidden lock dating back to the 1640s, London street signs, a Biba frock, and a piece of shrapnel from the battleship Bismarck.(n)

programme.title: The Luminaries
programme.sub-title: The Old Moon in the Young Moon's Arms
programme.desc: Anna is tried for murder, but Emery is still missing - along with her alibi - and Moody refuses to act on her behalf as he believes the case to be indefensible. However, due to a mix-up the lawyer ends up with Lauderback's trunk and discovers a series of letters from Crosbie that reveal a startling fact. Lydia hosts a seance to make contact with Emery, intending to implicate Anna further, but instead she channels the spirit of Sook and inadvertently accuses Carver of murder. Period drama, starring Eva Green.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, featuring Bournemouth v Southampton at the Vitality Stadium and Tottenham Hotspur v Leicester City at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Looking for Alaska
programme.sub-title: They Couldn't Hit an Elephant from This Distance - General Sedgwick
programme.desc: A truce with the Weekday Warriors proves short-lived, Alaska sets Miles up on his very first date at the school's basketball game, and Takumi has a suspicion who the rat might be.(n)

programme.title: Looking for Alaska
programme.sub-title: The Nourishment Is Palatable - Millard Fillmore
programme.desc: Miles agrees to spend Thanksgiving with Alaska, but a trip to the Colonel's home for the holiday that was designed to bring everyone together only leaves the group further apart.(n)

programme.desc: The return of the programme offering advice about which foods are healthy or harmful. Chris Bavin investigates worrying reports that eating chicken and turkey could cause cancer, and Gloria Hunniford looks at the trend for feeding pets raw meat.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the development of a semi in Mottingham in south-east London, a detached in Littleover, Derby and a terrace in Dover in Kent.(n)

programme.title: The Heights
programme.desc: Death reunites the residents once again, but some relationships are beyond repair, while Sabine pulls an outrageous stunt. Australian drama, starring Bridie McKim.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps an Anglo-Icelandic couple, who need to relocate from Reykjavik to Aberdeenshire on their £380,000 budget before their daughter starts university in the region.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A fibre artist, a ceramicist and an abstract painter create artworks for a Staffordshire who woman wants a piece to mark the birth of her first grandchild. Nick Knowles presents.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: With the help of archive, Jay Blades charts how three inventions fixed in the barn - a magic lantern, projector and mutoscope - helped influence modern TV and film technology.(n)

programme.title: Pointless

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Rylan Clark-Neal present the first visit of the week to the studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The World Health Organisation urged countries to stamp out infections as soon as they developed, but the UK government's initial scientific advice said the route out of the crisis was for most of us to catch the virus so we could develop 'herd immunity'. Dr Faye Kirkland investigates this approach to the Covid-19 pandemic, asking whether it was a dangerous gamble with people's lives or a sound scientific method. Faced with a growing backlash and warnings that the NHS was close to being overwhelmed, politicians denied herd immunity was the policy and within a few days Britain pivoted to a new strategy - lockdown.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders: Secrets from the Square
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley is joined by Diane Parish and Tameka Empson, aka sisters Denise and Kim Fox, for a socially-distanced reunion as Tameka returns to set for the first time since 2019. The pair reveal all about their close working relationship and tell the stories behind some of their biggest moments - from Tameka reliving her infamous live labour scenes for the show's 30th anniversary to Diane explaining why she once had to pretend to all her friends and family that she'd quit the soap.(n)

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.sub-title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Cash-strapped Alison and Mike think all their problems have been solved when they inherit a grand country house, unaware that it is falling apart and teeming with the ghosts of former inhabitants. The spooks must act immediately to halt the new owners' plans to turn the house into a hotel, but their attempts to scare them away fail miserably. Comedy, starring Mathew Baynton, Simon Farnaby, Martha Howe-Douglas, Jim Howick, Laurence Rickard, Ben Willbond, Charlotte Ritchie and Kiell Smith-Bynoe.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets She Keeps
programme.desc: Agatha and Hayden attend an emotional vigil for missing baby Ben, while Megan and Jack's relationship is deteriorating under the strain. Agatha begins to panic when she realises that 'Rory' is becoming seriously unwell, but she is unwilling to seek medical help..(n)

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: Simon brings in a friend to try to convince his two stars to put their faith in him, while Michael worries about a neighbour when he spots an ambulance outside next door. David not only manages to keep the house in order and the home-schooling ticking over in Georgia's absence, but also gets around to finishing a draft of his screenplay.(n)

programme.title: Enterprice
programme.desc: The two business partners head out on a double date, with Kazim the one in love and Jeremiah his reluctant wingman. Out of their comfort zone, they head to the East End to meet the girls, but what follows is a very strange dinner - which goes from bad to worse very quickly. Return of the comedy, starring Kayode Ewumi and Trieve Blackwood-Cambridge.(n)

programme.title: Canada's Drag Race
programme.desc: Deborah Cox hosts as the contestants do battle in a song-and-dance diss-track showdown, with judges Brooke Lynn Hytes, Jeffrey Bowyer-Chapman and Stacey McKenzie.(n)

programme.title: Peter Crouch: Save Our Summer
programme.desc: The former footballer hosts a variety entertainment show, featuring live music, comedy skits and a host of celebrity guests via video links. programme.desc: A large terraced house in Earlsfield in London, ancient woodland in Eythorne in Kent, and a building housing six flats in Tonypandy in Glamorgan are all sold at auction.(n)

programme.desc: A Coastguard crew fights to save a film extra who is taken ill at the top of a cathedral tower, and customers at a pub run from an out-of-control lorry. Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: The Heights
programme.desc: Time together is revealing for Ana and Ryan, and also for Renee and Mark. Kam faces a tough interview.(n)

programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin meets a couple of creative Californians keen to make a lifestyle leap to the Welsh borders, and also discovers how llamas are thriving in the British countryside.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Nick Knowles challenges an impressionist painter, a metal sculptor and an artist who paints in a caravan to create artwork for a London couple who have just renovated their home.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades revisits three fixes from the barn - a polyphon, gramophone and transistor radio - to tell the story of how modern music has been influenced by vintage music players.(n)

programme.title: Pointless

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Rylan Clark-Neal present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: In an episode originally broadcast on 27 October 1998, Pat and Peggy clash spectacularly following an accusation that Frank and Pat are having an affair behind their partners' backs. Frank searches for a missing Roy.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Kian returns to Darwin Ward, determined to make amends with Jac. But when forgiveness does not come easy, Kian goes into self-destruct mode - with almost fatal consequences. Meanwhile, a broken Essie searches for her purpose, but where will she find the answer she seeks? Ric suspects Guy has fallen off the wagon and sets out to stop him working at Holby, once and for all.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets She Keeps
programme.desc: With no money and Rory's health faltering, Agatha finds refuge in the storeroom of her old workplace. Meghan and Jack are at breaking point until Agatha takes a phone call from Hayden, who is in police custody. Laura Carmichael stars.(n)

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: In the final episode, the play's producer decides to draft in a voice of experience to get Michael and David in line. Meanwhile, Georgia shares David's work without him knowing, and he is pleasantly surprised by the enthusiastic response his work receives, and Michael seeks resolution on what has happened to his neighbour. Comedy, starring Michael Sheen and David Tennant.(n)

programme.title: How's Your Head, Hun
programme.sub-title: How's Your Head, Hun? with Michelle Visage
programme.desc: Michelle Visage welcomes comedian Keith Lemon, who chats about the appeal of crafting in a pandemic. Former footballer Alex Scott rings to inspire Michelle with her ambitious workouts, and the presenter gets on a treadmill with bestie Leah Remini.(n)

programme.title: Hayley Goes..
programme.desc: Hayley Pearce is proud of her working-class roots, but with the gap between rich and poor widening, she wants to know how easy it would be for her to move up a class. She overhauls her leisure activities with a spot of golf and some classical music, takes voice lessons to refine her accent and supercharges her table manners with an intense etiquette lesson. However, she soon discovers that there are obstacles in the way that can make social mobility very difficult.(n)

programme.title: Ambulance - Liverpool
programme.desc: Award-winning documentary following the North West Ambulance Service as they care for the people of Liverpool and all across Merseyside. The control room experiences a spike in calls for patients with breathing difficulties, and when Sherilee talks to a daughter calls whose mother has chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, it proves tough for the call handler as her own mum had the same illness. Meanwhile, call handler Brogan has to guide a caller through lifesaving CPR while they wait for an ambulance, and there's a full emergency at John Lennon Airport when a plane loses contact with air traffic control.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Artists create pieces for buyers in Chesterfield who want something special to remember their beloved fathers and stepdad, who they tragically lost in the space of two years.(n)
