programme.desc: The repairs of a cash register, a camera and a calculator, three pre-digital items that helped shape the modern computerised world people take for granted today.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: The final leg of Michael Portillo's journey begins in Edmonton, where he learns about the people who 300 years ago travelled huge distances by foot and canoe to trade with indigenous people. He also admires the city's early 20th-century streetcars, preserved by the Radial Railway Society, and its light rail system. Moving on, he views the Rocky Mountains, marvels at the scale of Canada's forestry industry and discovers how the beaver, once slaughtered for its fur, is now pampered.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on small creatures in an urban setting. In Rio de Janeiro, marmosets use power-lines as they would tree branches to scour the streets for food, and one animal becomes separated from its group and is forced to the ground, where it confronts the dangers of the city alone. Almost 11,000 miles away in the neon metropolis of Tokyo, a rhinoceros beetle begins an extraordinary journey to find sanctuary on a rare patch of greenery, along the way facing predatory bats, eight-eyed jumping spiders, praying mantises and a sharp-eyed crow. Including Hidden Kingdoms Revealed, showing how the film was made. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Susan Calman in which one contestant becomes the Boss and has to use judgement and tactics to decide which player is best suited to answer questions.(n)

programme.title: One Touch of Venus
programme.desc: A statue of the Greek goddess of love is displayed in a department store, but when an employee impulsively kisses the sculpture, it comes to life. The immortal being inspires romance among everyone she comes into contact with, while the hapless man who summoned her is accused of art theft. Musical comedy, starring Ava Gardner and Robert Walker.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: The Strictly Come Dancing judge takes model and presenter Melanie Sykes back to Llandudno in north Wales. Len surprises Melanie by picking her up in a Skoda 105 - just like the one her family had back in 1980. As they drive down the coast, the memories of a holiday she enjoyed in the area start flooding back. Plus, Mel provides an insight into her career, from modelling on the catwalks and appearing in a famous beer commercial, to presenting television shows.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: A final look back at the Rio Olympics, focusing on Britain's women's hockey team, Mo Farah in the 5,000m and Nicola Adams defending her London 2012 flyweight boxing title.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin visits the Watts Gallery in the heart of the Surrey countryside, where experts David Harper and Thomas Plant are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction. David uncovers a collection of British film and TV memorabilia and Thomas is thrilled by some French cameo glass. Paul is on the trail of Martians in Woking, the setting for HG Wells's sci-fi novel The War of the Worlds.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part two of two. Michael Portillo continues his exploration of Queensland, from the tropical rainforest to the Great Barrier Reef. At Mungalla Cattle Station, Michael joins the owner for a feast cooked underground, and after a sing-along at the Billabong, he makes tracks for Townsville and the gateway to the Great Barrier Reef. Pioneering photographs taken at the time of his Bradshaw's brought the corals to the world's attention and now two million people visit the reef annually.(n)

programme.title: Test Cricket Highlights
programme.sub-title: Today at the Test: England v West Indies
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents action from day one of the Third Test in the three-game series, held at Old Trafford. The Windies may still be a long way from reproducing the quality of their incredible teams of the 1970s and 80s, but their new pace attack has been heralded as one of the strongest in world cricket, and should provide a great test for the English batsmen, whose time at the crease of late has understandably been limited.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals the progress of his tomatoes and gives advice on the summer maintenance of ponds. Nick Bailey travels to South Africa to search for the wild cousins of vibrant summer flower the crocosmia, while garden historian Advolly Richmond heads to Alton Towers in Staffordshire to take a close look at the Victorian trend of creating theme parks in their gardens. Plus, a second chance to meet a couple in Staffordshire who are very particular about the colours of the plants they use in the borders of their cottage garden.(n)

programme.title: Miriam Margolyes: Almost Australian
programme.desc: The Oxford-born actress, who became an Australian citizen six years ago, embarks on a 10,000km drive around the country discovering more about the place she can now call home. Starting in Bondi, she meets up with an estate agent who reveals the prosperous migrant market. Heading west, Miriam is disturbed to discover that there is a growing number of women who can't afford a home in retirement, now making up the fastest growing number of homeless in the country. With most of eastern Australia in the grip of severe drought, Miriam heads to the country town of Trundle, to see the repercussions for herself.(n)

programme.title: I Love
programme.desc: A retrospective of a year when Boy George led the way in androgynous looks, Bananarama became the soundtrack to many a disco and Musical Youth passed the dutchie. Mouths were burned when sandwich toasters became the latest must-have kitchen appliance and the seedier side of student life was revealed in The Young Ones.(n)

programme.title: State of the Union
programme.desc: Tom has an awkward encounter, which affects his conversation with Louise about fading passion. Comedy, written by Nick Hornby and directed by Stephen Frears, starring Chris O'Dowd and Rosamund Pike.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: For a Few Dollars More
programme.desc: An enigmatic gunslinger forms an uneasy alliance with a military veteran to track down a notorious outlaw - but tensions simmer as their very different motives for the hunt put them increasingly at odds. Sergio Leone's Western sequel, starring Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Gian Maria Volonte, Josef Egger, Mara Krup and Klaus Kinski.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The World Health Organisation urged countries to stamp out infections as soon as they developed, but the UK government's initial scientific advice said the route out of the crisis was for most of us to catch the virus so we could develop 'herd immunity'. Dr Faye Kirkland investigates this approach to the Covid-19 pandemic, asking whether it was a dangerous gamble with people's lives or a sound scientific method. Faced with a growing backlash and warnings that the NHS was close to being overwhelmed, politicians denied herd immunity was the policy and within a few days Britain pivoted to a new strategy - lockdown.(n)

programme.title: Keith Haring: Street Art Boy
programme.desc: International art sensation Keith Haring blazed a trail through the art scene of 1980s New York and revolutionised the worlds of pop culture and fine art. When he was diagnosed with Aids in 1989, he asked writer John Gruen to write his biography, and the subsequent audio interviews form the basis of this profile. They are combined with archive footage and contributions from friends, critics and contemporaries, telling the artist's story from the sleepy Pennsylvania of his youth to the clubbing scene of New York and to the streets, where he made his instantly recognisable graffiti-like art.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Marrying Mum and Dad
programme.desc: Brother and sister Harry and Lilly conjure up a spellbinding extravaganza for their two mothers with a Witches and Wizards-themed wedding. Presenter Ed Petrie is joined by Harry Potter star Afshan Azad and Miss Drill from The Worst Witch to help the duo create a day of flying, fireballs and chocolate magic potions.(n)

programme.title: Wild & Weird
programme.desc: Odd animal transportation tales, including the poisonous frog helping to make air travel more safe and a convoy of caterpillars on the lookout for a new home.(n)

programme.title: All Over the Place
programme.desc: Ed Petrie and friends compete in an onion-eating competition in Newent.(n)

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Community on Solid Ground is a youth centre in Whalley Range. Before its current management took over the building the area didn't offer much for the youngsters living there and anti-social behaviour was very common. That has dropped by 73 per cent since Community on Solid Ground came along, the kids can hang out, play sports and have a place to go that means they aren't hanging around the streets. Sadly the facilities are very tired and they don't have areas they can play their beloved sport on, so the Dengineers are going to transform their outside space into a sports arena worthy of the Olympics. Presented by Mark Wright and Lauren Layfield.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve heads to Ecuador in search of ocean giants and the biggest baby animal on earth..(n)

programme.title: Britain's Most Sensational Backyard Builds
programme.desc: Sara Cox and Piers Taylor challenge three backyard inventors to let their imaginations run wild and come up with unique and visually stunning designs, including a sweet-dispensing carousel, an automated breakfast maker and a giant robot.(n)

programme.title: Bears About the House
programme.desc: Part two of two. Conservationist Giles Clark continues his biggest mission to date - taking on the illegal wildlife trade and helping to build a new bear sanctuary in Laos, south-east Asia. At the sanctuary, Mary the sun bear is now nine months old. Now growing in confidence, she is becoming extremely determined, and picks up a skill unique to a sun bear, jumping. Later, the sanctuary receives some shocking news when they discover there has been a break-in, and the distraught team have to come to terms with a theft.(n)

programme.title: Wild West: America's Great Frontier
programme.desc: A journey along America's West coast. The programme examines how the landscape is shaped by the Pacific Ocean as well as powerful forces beneath ground, particularly along the San Andreas Fault. The programme also visits the warm and sheltered waters of the Sea of Cortez, where animals including blue whales gather, and discovers how a small community in America's westernmost point have a unique relationship with grey whales.(n)

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella Lawson presents a guide to Italian cookery, demonstrating how to create traditional and exciting meals using ingredients that are widely available in most supermarkets. She begins by preparing Sicilian pasta with tomatoes, garlic and almonds, a family feast of tagliata and Tuscan fries, and a fiery egg dish designed for late-night parties.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades rescues a tired rocking chair, old scaffolding poles and a pair of dining chairs from the tip, enlisting Kev Paxton and Simion Hawton-Smith to help transform them.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton is tasked with helping a couple and their young sons to quit London and make a new life and home in Derbyshire, and spends time with an artisan knife-maker.(n)

programme.title: Hugh's Wild West
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates volunteers who help wildlife in the West Country, meeting a woman who has transformed her home into a hedgehog hospital.(n)

programme.title: Animals with Cameras
programme.desc: Gordon Buchanan and a team of scientists learn more about various species through the use of animal bodycams. In Namibia, they help conservationist Marlice van Vuuren find out whether the three orphaned cheetahs she has raised have developed the skills needed to hunt for themselves in the wild, with close-up footage revealing how the cats choose their prey. On Kanowna Island off the south coast of Australia, Gordon discovers how the fur seal population manages to thrive and hunt in the surrounding shark-infested waters, and in South Africa, cameras gives an insight into the lives of wild baboons.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti join the staff working in some of the most unusual hotels around the world, learning the tricks of the trade along the way. This time, Giles and Monica help out at The Torridon in the Scottish Highlands, Britain's most northerly five-star hotel. Its need to balance a luxury stay with being self-sufficient has Monica collecting seaweed for the kitchen and helping to herd Highland cattle, while Giles learns to change toilet seats and joins the staff in their afternoon off - for a swim in the beautiful but freezing-cold loch.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and green-fingered siblings Harry and David Rich travel to Milton Keynes to compete for the chance to create a garden for husband and wife Vinay and Raunak. Vinay loves to host barbecues, so he's after a garden where he can do all that in style. Raunak, meanwhile, is more interested in filling the garden with vivid and dramatic colours, to match the style of decor she has used throughout their house. Both want the garden to represent the Hindu religion's belief in the power and importance of nature.(n)

programme.title: Inside Central Station
programme.desc: Music festival goers descend on Glasgow, a street art mystery is revealed, and the oldest and youngest train cleaners on the station set to work.(n)

programme.title: Go Fish! With Will Millard
programme.desc: The presenter examines the world of carp fishing. Carp anglers spend days on end, guarding their rods on the side of ponds that have been heavily stocked with fish, ready to be caught time and time again. They sleep in tents by city centre ponds, medieval castles and industrial docks - anywhere they can to get the monster carp they crave. It is fast becoming the most popular form of fishing, drawing in youngsters and women to the sport. Will wants to find out why, so he immerses himself in its realm, attempting to beat his personal best from a very unlikely fishing spot in Cardiff city centre.(n)

programme.title: Test Cricket Highlights
programme.sub-title: Today at the Test: England v West Indies
programme.desc: Action from day two of the Third Test in the three-game series, held at Old Trafford. The Windies may still be a long way from reproducing the quality of their incredible teams of the 1970s and 80s, but their new pace attack has been heralded as one of the strongest in world cricket, and should provide a great test for the English batsmen, whose time at the crease of late has understandably been limited.(n)

programme.title: American History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: Lucy explores how American history has been mythologised and manipulated by generations of politicians, writers and protesters. She begins by examining the American Revolution - a David-and-Goliath battle of men with high ideals taking on the might of the British Empire. But how much of America's founding story is based on fact?(n)

programme.title: World Cup 1966: Alfie's Boys
programme.desc: David Jason presents a documentary about how Alf Ramsey recruited the England football team that won the world cup in 1966, and was able to unite the members into a world class side. Featuring archive footage of the team in action and contributions from Bobby Charlton, Jack Charlton, Jimmy Greaves, George Cohen, Tina Moore, Harry Redknapp, Terry Venables, Geoff Hurst and Gordon Banks.(n)

programme.title: Match of Their Day
programme.desc: A special episode of the programme dedicated to Jack Charlton, the World Cup winner and former Republic of Ireland manager, who died earlier this month at the age of 85.(n)

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: The first of three special editions of the archive music show focusing on hits from the 1960s, including songs by the Foundations, Julie Driscoll, Sandie Shaw and Procol Harum. Narrated by Mark Radcliffe.(n)

programme.title: Just Jim
programme.desc: A Welsh teenager leads a lonely life after being rejected by his only friend. He becomes fascinated by a mysterious American who moves in next door, and the new arrival offers him some advice on how to be cool. The youngster starts to develop the life he had always longed for, but begins to wonder if he was happier the way he used to be. Comedy drama, starring Emile Hirsch and Craig Roberts.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: MasterChef's John Torode continues his alphabetical journey, with this episode's recipes linked by the letter S. Mary Berry prepares salmon with a fresh sorrel and spinach sauce, and Nigel Slater cooks sea salt chocolate snaps.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and garden designer Danny Clarke tackle a neglected and boring backyard in Birmingham for its owner Sophie, who wants the area full of birds, bees and butterflies.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani and Matt Baker visit the Blean, an ancient woodland in the heart of Kent where they get an exclusive look at a unique wilding project. There is a report from Gloucestershire on the elusive pine marten, while one of the driest springs on record is causing big problems at Adam Henson's farm.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost brings viewers up-to-date on how his garden has been developing over the summer as well as offering advice on looking after and growing hydrangeas. In Devon, Toby Buckland shares tips on dealing with damaged shrubs, tree pruning and transplanting perennials, while Frances Tophill travels to West Sussex to meet a gardener and professor of biology whose garden has been planted with the conservation of insects in mind. Plus, a second chance to see Carol Klein's in-depth profile of a national collection of hydrangeas at Darley Park in Derby.(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: Carole Baxter demonstrates the difference between a bed of hardy annuals sown in a prepared bed alongside an unprepared bed, and George Anderson shows off his Joppa allotment.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Spain
programme.desc: The chef continues his culinary tour in Castile - a region famous not only for its vast plains and castles but also as the home of 11th-century military leader El Cid - before heading to La Mancha, an area renowned for its rustic dishes and wine production, as well as being the land of Miguel de Cervantes' literary character Don Quixote.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Dish of the Day
programme.desc: The food writer turns the contents of his weekly shop into seven more meals, showing how items that he often buys can be made more exciting by concocting delicious new flavour combinations. The dishes he ends up with include ricotta beefburger, smoked mackerel coleslaw, and lemon and thyme cake.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: The penultimate leg of Si King and Dave Myers' European baking tour takes them to France. Travelling from Lyon to Carcassonne, they learn the secrets of teeth-pulling nougat, go truffle hunting and meet up with Dave's old flatmate, whom he has not seen for 30 years. Culinary delights en route include tarte aux pralines, a savoury-stuffed brioche, apricot tarte Tatin and, of course, the traditional French baguette.(n)

programme.title: Stories of Us
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley and broadcaster Ashley John-Baptiste reveal the inspiring stories of people across the UK who lead spiritually and emotionally fulfilling lives. In this first edition, they set out to meet the people who have found inner peace, calm and equilibrium among the hustle and bustle of modern living. Kate takes to the open waters to experience how wild swimming has been a life-changer for some - and even a life-saver for others. Meanwhile, Ashley discovers how a little time living as a hermit could ease the pressures of busy lives.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: From the RAF Museum in Cosford, Shropshire, where antique experts Jonathan Pratt and Adam Partridge find a First World War pigeon capsule and a large collection of toy cars.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: The fourth and final part of a look back at the Games, focusing on the second half of the Games, and featuring cyclist Chris Hoy claim a second gold medal in the keirin.(n)

programme.title: A Wild Year
programme.sub-title: The North York Moors: A Wild Year
programme.desc: An exploration of the upland area of North Yorkshire, where heather-clad uplands and sheltered dales have been shaped both by the elements and by its people. Hardy Swaledale sheep roam the high moors all year round only coming down to the lowlands for lambing and shearing. Red grouse feed and breed amongst the heather alongside curlews and other ground nesting birds and billions of purple heather blooms provide nectar for the bees, brought to the moors by beekeepers in the summer. Toby Jones narrates, as time-lapse camera techniques bring fresh insight into the restless rhythms of the region.(n)

programme.title: Test Cricket Highlights
programme.sub-title: Today at the Test: England v West Indies
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents action from day four of the Second Test in the three-game series, held at Old Trafford. It is the first time this venue has hosted a Test match since last September, when England lost the Fourth Test of the 2019 Ashes series to Australia. With analysis from Michael Vaughan and commentary by Alastair Cook, Carlos Brathwaite, Phil Tufnell and Alison Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Sport Re-run
programme.desc: Stephen Watson introduces the Ulster Senior Football Championship quarter-final clash between Derry and Down from 1994, which was regarded as one of the finest matches of that year. Former Derry player-turned-pundit Joe Brolly reflects on what could have been for his county, as Down progressed to lift the famous Sam Maguire Cup.(n)

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan: From My Sofa
programme.desc: Romesh catches up with old friends from Albania, Mongolia and The Arctic, revisiting some of the highlights and introducing never-before-seen moments such as his near-death experience in a high-speed Mongolia car rally.(n)

programme.title: Trump in Tweets
programme.desc: Documentary taking an in-depth look at US President Donald Trump's use of social media, examining the impact of his tweets on politics both in America and across the world. With access to people in his inner circle, interviews with experts and journalists, as well as some of his most avid Twitter followers, the programme tells the story of how Trump has used Twitter as a tool to shape policy, conduct diplomacy and wage war on the establishment. Narrated by The Vivienne.(n)

programme.title: Donald Trump: All-American Billionaire
programme.desc: In a programme first shown in 2010, well before he became US President, Emily Maitlis profiles the property tycoon, exploring the controversy surrounding his plans to develop a golf resort on sand dunes near Aberdeen. She also investigates how he amassed his multi-billion-dollar fortune, and discovers why his extravagant lifestyle serves to reinforce his business brand. Featuring interviews with Trump himself, as well as members of his family and TV producer Mark Burnett, who helped make the businessman one of America's biggest small-screen stars on the original version of The Apprentice.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: A report from Salford as the city lifts the lockdown and tries to get its community back to work. The programme follows the mayor and his team, looking at the burden that has fallen on local councils, and also showing the work done by teachers, bus drivers and those helping the homeless. But for Salford it has been expensive. With the threat of bankruptcy looming, can the council provide the support and services the locals need to get them through the next phase of the health and economic crisis?(n)

programme.title: Ambulance - Liverpool
programme.desc: Advanced paramedic Kirsten is faced with an unusual job. A call has come in from police about a burglar who has injured himself trying to escape from the house he was looting. As she arrives, she finds him in agony with a nasty open fracture on his leg. Later, Kelsey and Dave are called to a pregnant woman in a lot of pain who worries she may be in early labour, and Gareth and Gabby treat a woman who is struggling with her breathing. But then two high-priority calls come in - both of which involve children.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Nicky wakes up in hospital to find her overbearing mother interfering in both her work and personal life. She takes the opportunity to reassess her priorities. Fletch and Essie befriend a cancer patient, but the relationship forces all three of them to confront some ugly truths about what the future holds. Guy tries to prove he still has what it takes, and tries to persuade Max to approve a risky operation.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Three talented artists to make something special for the homes of people they've never met. In Lincolnshire, a buyer is looking for a gift for her husband as a thank-you for all he does for the family and to mark his long service to charity work. Will a stone sculptor, a mosaic maker or an illustrator create the perfect present? Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades explores the First World War's legacy on the UK today, through archive and delving deeper into three barn fixes - some bagpipes, a soldier's wire cutters and two RAF mascots.(n)

programme.title: Blue Planet Revisited
programme.desc: Scientists find out what the future holds for the Great Barrier Reef, monitoring green turtles, following families of breeding birds and meeting the reef's curious residents.(n)

programme.title: The Week in Parliament
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's proceedings in Parliament, presented by David Cornock..(n)

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Examining the heartland of the country, home to ancient structures such as the Great Wall and modern buildings like Beijing's Olympic Stadium, as well as animals including the giant panda and golden snub-nosed monkey. However, the region holds even deeper cultural significance as the land of origin of China's most populous ethnic group the Han people - whose 5,000-year-old traditions are increasingly under threat.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Susan Calman in which one contestant becomes the Boss and has to use judgement and tactics to decide which player is best suited to answer questions.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces dishes that are good to make in advance, including Mary Berry's fresh fruit salad, James Martin's chicken stew, the Hairy Bikers' autumn pudding, Nigel Slater's bean soup, and Nigella Lawson's ice-cream cake.(n)

programme.title: Wild Brazil
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan narrates a documentary following capuchin monkeys, giant otters and coatis as they strive to raise their families. The first episode sees the young animals taking their first steps in some of the world's most extraordinary habitats, where they have to beware of deadly predators including the jaguar and caiman.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: The first of five programmes looking back at the 2016 Rio Olympics, focusing on the opening six days - which included Adam Peaty's 100m breaststroke gold medal in the pool.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antique experts Catherine Southon and James Lewis scour a crowd at Ushaw in Co Durham to find objects to take off to auction. Catherine comes across a toy speedboat in its original box and James discovers a rare poster that came from a morgue which shows the average weight of adult organs. Host Paul Martin looks at some rare Catholic artefacts that survived the English Reformation.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part two of two. Michael Portillo concludes his journey from Adelaide to Perth, striking gold and playing cards in Kalgoorlie, and uncovering a dark chapter of the past in Perth.(n)

programme.title: Test Cricket Highlights
programme.sub-title: Today at the Test: England v West Indies
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents action from day five of the Second Test in the three-game series, held at Old Trafford. England are hoping to avenge a series defeat away to the Windies last summer. With analysis from Michael Vaughan and commentary by Alastair Cook, Carlos Brathwaite, Phil Tufnell and Alison Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Our Friend Victoria
programme.desc: The comedy of Victoria Wood is celebrated by Richard E Grant, with characters including Kimberley's friend, Jim Broadbent's northern playwright and Patricia Routledge's extraordinary monologues as Kitty. With contributions from Julie Walters and Michael Ball, as well as rare behind the scenes photos from her personal archive.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the second of the student quiz's first-round matches, four students from the University of Leicester pit their wits against a team from Durham University in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Iraq
programme.desc: A look at the impact of the insurgency from the perspectives of American soldier Lt Col Nate Sassaman and Baghdadi Alaa Adel, who was 12 when she suffered life-changing injuries. Unprepared for the hostile environment he found himself in, Sassaman was pushed to the very darkest regions of his psyche. Alaa was hit in the face by shrapnel from one of the first roadside bombs planted by insurgents and intended for American forces. Looking back at that time, both question the benefits of the war in Iraq.(n)

programme.title: Tír na nÓg
programme.desc: The students get to grips with the rules and face new challenges. They start planning for the concert, and the excitement of the first disco has everyone in high spirits. In Irish.(n)

programme.title: Strasbourg 1518
programme.desc: Jonathan Glazer's short dance film inspired by an event in which an involuntary mania took hold of citizens in the city of Strasbourg just over 500 years ago.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Million Dollar Wedding Planner
programme.desc: The exclusive world of Lelian Chew, who organises nuptials for the super-rich in the Far East, taking on 10 just ceremonies a year at an average cost of $1million each. Bespoke Cartier jewellery, hundreds of thousands of dollars of flowers and multiple designer wedding dresses are nothing out of the ordinary. But Lelian's job also involves navigating the clash between age-old Chinese marriage customs and the desires of the young, often with outlandish solutions - multiple weddings are becoming the norm for the Chinese super-rich.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani and Matt Baker visit the Blean, an ancient woodland in the heart of Kent where they get an exclusive look at a unique wilding project. There is a report from Gloucestershire on the elusive pine marten, while one of the driest springs on record is causing big problems at Adam Henson's farm.(n)

programme.title: Saving Our Nurses
programme.desc: Newly qualified physiotherapist Esther dreads her forthcoming move from the neurology department to outpatients and the proposed switch is causing her some worrying health problems. Occupational therapist Melissa cares deeply for her patients, but her dyslexia and the demands of essential paperwork means she's losing motivation for her job.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Actor Phil Daniels, drag artist Baga Chipz, Olympic hockey gold medallist and sports presenter Sam Quek, conductor for the Kingdom Choir Karen Gibson and TV presenter Dominic Littlewood compete in the kitchen. For their first challenge, they head to the MasterChef Market - stocked full of the best quality produce from across the world including meat, fish, fruit, vegetables, nuts, pulses, herbs and spices. The challenge is to invent and then cook one dish to show the judges they have potential. Presented by John Torode and Gregg Wallace.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A fibre artist, a ceramicist and an abstract painter create artworks for a Staffordshire who woman wants a piece to mark the birth of her first grandchild. Nick Knowles presents.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: With the help of archive, Jay Blades charts how three inventions fixed in the barn - a magic lantern, projector and mutoscope - helped influence modern TV and film technology.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: From her garden at Glebe Cottage in Devon, Carol Klein goes back to the basics of propagating plants by demonstrating how to take cuttings. There is also an interview with Advolly Richmond, whose love of garden history is reflected in her own garden, and she shares her passion for a flower with a surprising past. Joe Swift has a large plant in his London garden that is due for some timely remedial work, and the team travels to Brighton to visit a garden packed with exotic plants grown in raised beds and containers.(n)

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The series concludes with a visit to the country's eastern seaboard to investigate how the Chinese government is managing environmental concerns while meeting the ever-expanding needs of the population. Among the region's diverse locales lie futuristic cities, seaweed-thatched villages and rugged wetlands that are home to some of the world's rarest animal species.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Susan Calman in which one contestant becomes the Boss and has to use judgement and tactics to decide which player is best suited to answer questions.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Nick Crane explores the wealth of wildlife attracted to the Firth of Forth. Tessa Dunlop reveals how the Victorian zeal for cleanliness turned the Thames into a giant toilet bowl.(n)

programme.title: Wild Brazil
programme.desc: The animal families face the formidable monsoon rains and the giant otter cubs must watch out for predatory jaguars and learn to swim before their river floods. The coatis have to eat as much as they can ahead of their habitat disappearing underwater, while the youngest capuchin monkey needs to master some clever survival skills. Stephen Mangan narrates.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: A look back at days seven and eight of the Rio Olympics, where British focus was on the likes of Mo Farah, Bradley Wiggins, Helen Glover and Laura Kenny.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: At Ushaw in Co Durham, antique experts David Fletcher and James Lewis put a value on the region's antiques and collectibles. David is delighted by a 1950s toy plane, while James finds a 1940s menu from a famous Hollywood restaurant which has been signed by some top film stars. Host Paul Martin visits the Mining Art Gallery in Bishop Auckland to find out why many coal miners were inspired to pick up a paintbrush.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses the south east of Australia from Canberra, the seat of government, to the multi-ethnic heart of its second largest city, Melbourne. Floating above Canberra in a hot-air balloon, Michael sees how Australia's 'Bush Capital' was planned in the early 20th century and tours the nation's Parliament. He takes the high-speed train nearly 300 miles south west, to arrive in Melbourne at the head of Port Philip Bay on Australia's south-eastern coast.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for..
programme.desc: The Ellises sample life in the 1970s, an age of power cuts and strikes, but also a golden era for working class families. They enjoy rare time together helped with the advent of their first record player and car, while actress Claire Sweeney brings 'Scouse', her family's speciality, round for tea. Sara Cox and Polly Russell present.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti join the staff working in some of the most unusual hotels around the world, learning the tricks of the trade along the way. This time, Giles and Monica help out at The Torridon in the Scottish Highlands, Britain's most northerly five-star hotel. Its need to balance a luxury stay with being self-sufficient has Monica collecting seaweed for the kitchen and helping to herd Highland cattle, while Giles learns to change toilet seats and joins the staff in their afternoon off - for a swim in the beautiful but freezing-cold loch.(n)

programme.title: The Rise of the Murdoch Dynasty
programme.desc: A huge scandal threatens Rupert's dream of passing on the family business to one of his children, resulting in 'the most humble day' of his life. In response to the revelations, the Murdoch Empire goes on the offensive and the alliance against him come under sustained pressure, but whistle-blowers begin to emerge, then a bombshell revelation completely changes public opinion. A sequence of disastrous events leaves Murdoch's business plans in ruins, and he closes the News of the World newspaper.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jon Richardson, Sara Pascoe and Nathan Caton
programme.desc: Jon Richardson, team captain on 8 Out of 10 Cats, hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, west London, warming up the crowd before introducing routines by fellow comedians Sara Pascoe and Nathan Caton.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan: From My Sofa
programme.desc: Romesh catches up with old friends from Albania, Mongolia and The Arctic, revisiting some of the highlights and introducing never-before-seen moments such as his near-death experience in a high-speed Mongolia car rally.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades narrates a spin-off show delving deeper into three repairs to show how the heirlooms help shaped modern life, beginning with the story of toys.(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: George Anderson keeps an eye on his cuttings and Kirsty Wilson is extra careful as she shows how to propagate cacti. There is good news and bad news on an allotment in Aberdeen.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The four remaining contestants are split into pairs and tasked with cooking the same dish, which must be identical in both appearance and flavour - but there's a catch. They are separated by a wall, meaning the key to the task is communication as one pair recreates John Torode's pan-fried cod wrapped in ham and the other tackles his calf's liver and champ mash. For the second task, the competitors are sent out on their first mass catering challenge, at the McLaren Technology Centre in Woking, Surrey.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Nick Knowles challenges an impressionist painter, a metal sculptor and an artist who paints in a caravan to create artwork for a London couple who have just renovated their home.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades revisits three fixes from the barn - a polyphon, gramophone and transistor radio - to tell the story of how modern music has been influenced by vintage music players.(n)

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits the Thai capital of Bangkok, where he learns how the late 19th-century King Rama V built a grand palace and introduced railways to the country. Michael also learns that King Rama V's love of steam engines was inspired by Queen Victoria. Moving on, the presenter also confronts his fear of snakes to assist in a surgical operation on a venomous king cobra and steps into the ring to learn Muay Thai boxing.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the survival techniques used by the animal kingdom's smallest creatures. North America's Sonoran Desert is home to the grasshopper mouse, which is capable of disarming scorpions and centipedes twice its size, and displays a power and athleticism that enables it to avoid the attentions of rattlesnakes and tarantulas. In Africa, the elephant shrew, known as the sengi, employs speed to keep its distance from predators, following a meticulously constructed - and maintained - network of tiny racetracks in the savannah. The film concludes with Hidden Kingdoms Revealed, a 10-minute report on how the documentary was made. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Update on politics from Westminster and beyond.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Susan Calman in which one contestant becomes the Boss and has to use judgement and tactics to decide which player is best suited to answer questions.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Len Goodman and a celebrity guest reminisce about one of their favourite holidays. This time, BBC weather presenter Carol Kirkwood revisits St Helier in Jersey.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels to the Netherlands, where Nick Crane explores how Dutch engineers created massive coastal defences following the North Sea floods in 1953 that killed thousands of people. Historian Tessa Dunlop investigates why the tulip trade nearly bankrupted the country 400 years ago, Mark Horton discovers how a large area of coastal land was drained to create new living space, and Miranda Krestovnikoff finds out about raw herring becoming a popular seaside snack. Meanwhile, Countryfile's Adam Henson traces the history of the Friesian cow trade with Britain.(n)

programme.title: Wild Brazil
programme.desc: A fierce drought culminates in huge and ferocious fires, and the capuchin monkeys, giant otters and coatis must use their survival skills to endure the extreme conditions. The animals are also looking for mates so they can breed in time to ensure the next generation are born at the optimal moment.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: Days nine and 10 of the Rio Olympics, which saw gymnast Max Whitlock lead the way by claiming two gold medals in one day with victory in the pommel horse and floor exercises.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antique experts Catherine Southon and David Fletcher scour a crowd at Ushaw in Co Durham to find objects to take off to auction. Catherine uncovers a large collection of glassware and stoneware dug up in the north east of England, while David finds an American money box in the shape of a bulldog. Host Paul Martin visits the Oriental Museum at Durham University to find out about the collection of Malcolm McDonald, a British diplomat who was passionate about Asian ceramics.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz show, presented by Jeremy Vine in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his exploration of southeast Australia in Melbourne, Victoria, where he visits a home in the suburbs of Lilydale that once belonged to Dame Nellie Melba. Later, he travels through the rainforest of the Dandenong mountains across a spectacular trestle bridge, before reaching St Kilda, where he enjoys a special screening of a feature film that explores the exploits of the notorious outlaw, Ned Kelly.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for..
programme.desc: The Ellises sample life in the 1980s and 1990s, and experience their first telephone, chest freezer and toastie maker. The girls also absorb the Manchester music scene with Shaun Ryder, before the family have a millennium party. Sara Cox and Polly Russell present.(n)

programme.title: Bears About the House
programme.desc: Part two of two. Conservationist Giles Clark continues his biggest mission to date - taking on the illegal wildlife trade and helping to build a new bear sanctuary in Laos, south-east Asia. At the sanctuary, Mary the sun bear is now nine months old. Now growing in confidence, she is becoming extremely determined, and picks up a skill unique to a sun bear, jumping. Later, the sanctuary receives some shocking news when they discover there has been a break-in, and the distraught team have to come to terms with a theft.(n)

programme.title: Mrs America
programme.desc: It's 1973, and with 33 of the necessary 38 states ratifying the Equal Rights Amendment, Phyllis Schlafly's campaign has polarised opinion in the critical state of Illinois. The proponents offer her a challenge to publicly debate the issues, but are surprised by a counter-offer for a 'couple's debate' on national television. Drama about the political movement to pass the Equal Rights Amendment in the US. Starring Cate Blanchett, Rose Byrne, Uzo Aduba and Elizabeth Banks.(n)

programme.title: Mrs America
programme.desc: In February 1975, Jill Ruckelshaus is appointed chairwoman of a National Commission to honour women and urge ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment, but she has to contend with Phyllis Schlafly. Starring Cate Blanchett, Rose Byrne, Uzo Aduba and Elizabeth Banks.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton travels to the Shetland Isles, meeting Brydon Thomason from Shetland Nature on the island of Yell.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events. Presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Iraq
programme.desc: A look at the impact of the insurgency from the perspectives of American soldier Lt Col Nate Sassaman and Baghdadi Alaa Adel, who was 12 when she suffered life-changing injuries.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades narrates a look at three unique items from the home front during Second World War - a doll, a music box, and a homemade telescope built by an air raid warden.(n)

programme.title: Inside Monaco: Playground of the Rich
programme.desc: The final episode of the documentary features a tour of an extraordinary new home - Villa Troglodyte, which has come onto the market. Built as if carved out of the rock, the price is 'only' £23million because it doesn't have a sea view. The pressure to build more houses in such a small country has left Prince Albert with a challenge. Cameras follow him as he attends meetings about a huge two-billion-euro land extension project he has initiated. Extending into the sea is a complex operation, but once complete the largest villas there are estimated to sell for around 100million euros.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Chef and restaurateur John Torode and food writer and ingredients expert Gregg Wallace judge the four remaining contestants battling for semi-final places, tasking them to cook a faultless two-course meal. Lending their thoughts on proceedings are three legends of the series - finalist and TV presenter Rylan Clark-Neal and champions Sophie Thompson and Kimberly Wyatt. They know exactly what it takes to get through this competition and are almost certainly in for a treat as the contenders push the boat out in a bid to secure their semi-final place.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Artists create pieces for buyers in Chesterfield who want something special to remember their beloved fathers and a stepdad, who they lost within the space of two years.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: Jay Blades traces heroic stories from the Second World War and how they still resonate today, revisiting three fixes from the barn; a watch, swagger stick and belt.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.sub-title: Inside the Factory: Keeping Britain Going
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace catches up with workers at the Walkers Crisps factory in Leicester, which he visited in 2016, finding out how they are coping during the coronavirus crisis. He speaks to manager Carl Lewis, who reveals that in order to keep up with demand they're making big changes to their output, switching away from single packets to a situation where 90 per cent of production is now the multipacks sold in supermarkets.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates another documentary revealing the survival techniques of the animal kingdom's smallest creatures. This film follows a young tree shrew as it darts through the rainforest of Borneo on the lookout for food. The creature's super-fast metabolism means it is always hungry, but as it searches for fruit, it must avoid fire ants, giant snakes and even a carnivorous plant. Cameras also follow a male chipmunk collecting acorns in preparation for winter - but while he's out, a bigger, more aggressive neighbour ransacks his store. Can he get the nuts back?(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Susan Calman in which one contestant becomes the Boss and has to use judgement and tactics to decide which player is best suited to answer questions.(n)

programme.title: The Spanish Main
programme.desc: Dutch refugees shipwrecked on the coast of Cartagene in Spain are imprisoned by a villainous colonial governor. However, the leader of the group manages to escape and goes on to become a feared pirate captain. He then returns five years later to exact revenge. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Paul Henreid, Maureen O'Hara, Walter Slezak and Binnie Barnes.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Len takes actress Lisa Riley - best known to Emmerdale fans as Mandy Dingle on a journey to Bronte Country - Haworth in West Yorkshire - to re-create a family trip there in 1992. The pair travel in a Citroen CX, just like the one Lisa's mum drove all those years ago, and after the obligatory Barbra Streisand singalong, Lisa explains the importance of the Bronte sisters on her childhood. Along the way, Len and Lisa take a trip on a steam train, visit the Bronte memorial chapel and chat about the actress's career.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: A look back at three more days of the Rio Olympics, which saw Laura Trott and Jason Kenny claim their second and third gold medals of the Games respectively.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Jonathan Pratt and Michael Baggott assess items at Barrow Hill Roundhouse in Derbyshire and Paul Martin visits the village of Hathersage, which provided inspiration for Jane Eyre.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz show, presented by Jeremy Vine in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels by rail through Queensland from Kuranda to Townsville, marvelling at the engineering expertise of a railway line built in the 1890s. He also visits a plantation where he learns how to harvest sugar cane and ventures into the hinterland, where he braves a crocodile safari.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for..
programme.desc: The Ellis family reflects on their time-travelling adventure, and explores how the legacy of 100 years of history lives on in the northern diet today. Lesley and Sara Cox visit a Liverpool bakery, and sisters Caitlin and Freya examine how recent changes on Manchester's Curry Mile affect peoples' evolving relationship with flavour. Finally Sara and northern chef Rob Owen Brown prepare a celebration meal for the family.(n)

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The contestants do the make-up for London Fashion Week models, replicating the look demonstrated by Dominic Skinner - and with tight deadlines to meet, the pressure is on. As if that were not bad enough, fashion designer Henry Holland is the guest judge, helping to decide which two hopefuls will receive the 15-minute penalty in the next challenge, which involves creating a look based on a personal icon.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig asks questions on the theme of 'radio activity', with Joe Lycett, Shazia Mirza, Josh Widdicombe and Alan Davies trying to come up with interesting answers - while avoiding the most obvious ones.(n)

programme.title: There She Goes
programme.desc: Emily is getting excited about her favourite night of the year, Simon's annual pub quiz. However, when the evening arrives, Gandalf has a fall and cannot babysit, leaving her with a choice - miss the quiz or take Rosie along to the pub. In the early timeline, Emily goes back to work and puts Rosie into a nursery, only for the youngster to suffer a frightening medical emergency.(n)

programme.title: Frankie Boyle Live: Excited for You to See and Hate This
programme.desc: The comedian takes to the stage of the King's Theatre in his home town of Glasgow after completing his first major tour of Scotland in 12 years. Frankie turns his attention to a number of diverse subjects, including Glasgow's relationship with swearing and vitamins, British politics, his concerns about ageing, buying a dog and the nature of comedy itself.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: The Rise of the Murdoch Dynasty
programme.desc: A huge scandal threatens Rupert's dream of passing on the family business to one of his children, resulting in 'the most humble day' of his life. In response to the revelations, the Murdoch Empire goes on the offensive and the alliance against him come under sustained pressure, but whistle-blowers begin to emerge, then a bombshell revelation completely changes public opinion. A sequence of disastrous events leaves Murdoch's business plans in ruins, and he closes the News of the World newspaper.(n)

programme.title: Alex Brooker: Disability and Me
programme.desc: The Last Leg presenter confronts what disability really means in Britain today. Alex is reunited with a childhood friend who has spina bifida, who challenges him to consider the impact of making jokes about his own disability. He also pays a visit to a bespoke disability helpline, meets members of Arsenal's disabled supporters club, and talks to Paralympic swimmer Susie Rodgers about her life.(n)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley
programme.desc: The presenter reports on how southern Spain has become the main gateway for drugs into Europe, leading to violent turf wars between gangs and a government crackdown as the police struggle to regain control of their streets. Stacey goes on aerial patrol with police officers guarding the strip of water between Morocco and Spain, and discovers the extraordinary lengths smugglers will take to evade them, including travelling at 100mph in speedboats during extreme weather conditions.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A stone carver, a fine art painter and a heraldic artist pitch ideas for a piece of art to celebrate the 850th anniversary of a Scottish castle. Hosted by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop: Fixing Britain
programme.desc: The repairs of a cash register, a camera and a calculator, three pre-digital items that helped shape the modern computerised world people take for granted today.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: The final leg of Michael Portillo's journey begins in Edmonton, where he learns about the people who 300 years ago travelled huge distances by foot and canoe to trade with indigenous people. He also admires the city's early 20th-century streetcars, preserved by the Radial Railway Society, and its light rail system. Moving on, he views the Rocky Mountains, marvels at the scale of Canada's forestry industry and discovers how the beaver, once slaughtered for its fur, is now pampered.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on small creatures in an urban setting. In Rio de Janeiro, marmosets use power-lines as they would tree branches to scour the streets for food, and one animal becomes separated from its group and is forced to the ground, where it confronts the dangers of the city alone. Almost 11,000 miles away in the neon metropolis of Tokyo, a rhinoceros beetle begins an extraordinary journey to find sanctuary on a rare patch of greenery, along the way facing predatory bats, eight-eyed jumping spiders, praying mantises and a sharp-eyed crow. Including Hidden Kingdoms Revealed, showing how the film was made. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Susan Calman in which one contestant becomes the Boss and has to use judgement and tactics to decide which player is best suited to answer questions.(n)

programme.title: One Touch of Venus
programme.desc: A statue of the Greek goddess of love is displayed in a department store, but when an employee impulsively kisses the sculpture, it comes to life. The immortal being inspires romance among everyone she comes into contact with, while the hapless man who summoned her is accused of art theft. Musical comedy, starring Ava Gardner and Robert Walker.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: The Strictly Come Dancing judge takes model and presenter Melanie Sykes back to Llandudno in north Wales. Len surprises Melanie by picking her up in a Skoda 105 - just like the one her family had back in 1980. As they drive down the coast, the memories of a holiday she enjoyed in the area start flooding back. Plus, Mel provides an insight into her career, from modelling on the catwalks and appearing in a famous beer commercial, to presenting television shows.(n)

programme.title: Olympics Rewind
programme.desc: A final look back at the Rio Olympics, focusing on Britain's women's hockey team, Mo Farah in the 5,000m and Nicola Adams defending her London 2012 flyweight boxing title.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin visits the Watts Gallery in the heart of the Surrey countryside, where experts David Harper and Thomas Plant are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction. David uncovers a collection of British film and TV memorabilia and Thomas is thrilled by some French cameo glass. Paul is on the trail of Martians in Woking, the setting for HG Wells's sci-fi novel The War of the Worlds.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part two of two. Michael Portillo continues his exploration of Queensland, from the tropical rainforest to the Great Barrier Reef. At Mungalla Cattle Station, Michael joins the owner for a feast cooked underground, and after a sing-along at the Billabong, he makes tracks for Townsville and the gateway to the Great Barrier Reef. Pioneering photographs taken at the time of his Bradshaw's brought the corals to the world's attention and now two million people visit the reef annually.(n)

programme.title: Test Cricket Highlights
programme.sub-title: Today at the Test: England v West Indies
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents action from day one of the Third Test in the three-game series, held at Old Trafford. The Windies may still be a long way from reproducing the quality of their incredible teams of the 1970s and 80s, but their new pace attack has been heralded as one of the strongest in world cricket, and should provide a great test for the English batsmen, whose time at the crease of late has understandably been limited.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals the progress of his tomatoes and gives advice on the summer maintenance of ponds. Nick Bailey travels to South Africa to search for the wild cousins of vibrant summer flower the crocosmia, while garden historian Advolly Richmond heads to Alton Towers in Staffordshire to take a close look at the Victorian trend of creating theme parks in their gardens. Plus, a second chance to meet a couple in Staffordshire who are very particular about the colours of the plants they use in the borders of their cottage garden.(n)

programme.title: Miriam Margolyes: Almost Australian
programme.desc: The Oxford-born actress, who became an Australian citizen six years ago, embarks on a 10,000km drive around the country discovering more about the place she can now call home. Starting in Bondi, she meets up with an estate agent who reveals the prosperous migrant market. Heading west, Miriam is disturbed to discover that there is a growing number of women who can't afford a home in retirement, now making up the fastest growing number of homeless in the country. With most of eastern Australia in the grip of severe drought, Miriam heads to the country town of Trundle, to see the repercussions for herself.(n)

programme.title: I Love
programme.desc: A retrospective of a year when Boy George led the way in androgynous looks, Bananarama became the soundtrack to many a disco and Musical Youth passed the dutchie. Mouths were burned when sandwich toasters became the latest must-have kitchen appliance and the seedier side of student life was revealed in The Young Ones.(n)

programme.title: State of the Union
programme.desc: Tom has an awkward encounter, which affects his conversation with Louise about fading passion. Comedy, written by Nick Hornby and directed by Stephen Frears, starring Chris O'Dowd and Rosamund Pike.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: For a Few Dollars More
programme.desc: An enigmatic gunslinger forms an uneasy alliance with a military veteran to track down a notorious outlaw - but tensions simmer as their very different motives for the hunt put them increasingly at odds. Sergio Leone's Western sequel, starring Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Gian Maria Volonte, Josef Egger, Mara Krup and Klaus Kinski.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The World Health Organisation urged countries to stamp out infections as soon as they developed, but the UK government's initial scientific advice said the route out of the crisis was for most of us to catch the virus so we could develop 'herd immunity'. Dr Faye Kirkland investigates this approach to the Covid-19 pandemic, asking whether it was a dangerous gamble with people's lives or a sound scientific method. Faced with a growing backlash and warnings that the NHS was close to being overwhelmed, politicians denied herd immunity was the policy and within a few days Britain pivoted to a new strategy - lockdown.(n)

programme.title: Keith Haring: Street Art Boy
programme.desc: International art sensation Keith Haring blazed a trail through the art scene of 1980s New York and revolutionised the worlds of pop culture and fine art. When he was diagnosed with Aids in 1989, he asked writer John Gruen to write his biography, and the subsequent audio interviews form the basis of this profile. They are combined with archive footage and contributions from friends, critics and contemporaries, telling the artist's story from the sleepy Pennsylvania of his youth to the clubbing scene of New York and to the streets, where he made his instantly recognisable graffiti-like art.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Marrying Mum and Dad
programme.desc: Brother and sister Harry and Lilly conjure up a spellbinding extravaganza for their two mothers with a Witches and Wizards-themed wedding. Presenter Ed Petrie is joined by Harry Potter star Afshan Azad and Miss Drill from The Worst Witch to help the duo create a day of flying, fireballs and chocolate magic potions.(n)

programme.title: Wild & Weird
programme.desc: Odd animal transportation tales, including the poisonous frog helping to make air travel more safe and a convoy of caterpillars on the lookout for a new home.(n)

programme.title: All Over the Place
programme.desc: Ed Petrie and friends compete in an onion-eating competition in Newent.(n)

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Community on Solid Ground is a youth centre in Whalley Range. Before its current management took over the building the area didn't offer much for the youngsters living there and anti-social behaviour was very common. That has dropped by 73 per cent since Community on Solid Ground came along, the kids can hang out, play sports and have a place to go that means they aren't hanging around the streets. Sadly the facilities are very tired and they don't have areas they can play their beloved sport on, so the Dengineers are going to transform their outside space into a sports arena worthy of the Olympics. Presented by Mark Wright and Lauren Layfield.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve heads to Ecuador in search of ocean giants and the biggest baby animal on earth..(n)

programme.title: Britain's Most Sensational Backyard Builds
programme.desc: Sara Cox and Piers Taylor challenge three backyard inventors to let their imaginations run wild and come up with unique and visually stunning designs, including a sweet-dispensing carousel, an automated breakfast maker and a giant robot.(n)

programme.title: Bears About the House
programme.desc: Part two of two. Conservationist Giles Clark continues his biggest mission to date - taking on the illegal wildlife trade and helping to build a new bear sanctuary in Laos, south-east Asia. At the sanctuary, Mary the sun bear is now nine months old. Now growing in confidence, she is becoming extremely determined, and picks up a skill unique to a sun bear, jumping. Later, the sanctuary receives some shocking news when they discover there has been a break-in, and the distraught team have to come to terms with a theft.(n)

programme.title: Wild West: America's Great Frontier
programme.desc: A journey along America's West coast. The programme examines how the landscape is shaped by the Pacific Ocean as well as powerful forces beneath ground, particularly along the San Andreas Fault. The programme also visits the warm and sheltered waters of the Sea of Cortez, where animals including blue whales gather, and discovers how a small community in America's westernmost point have a unique relationship with grey whales.(n)

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella Lawson presents a guide to Italian cookery, demonstrating how to create traditional and exciting meals using ingredients that are widely available in most supermarkets. She begins by preparing Sicilian pasta with tomatoes, garlic and almonds, a family feast of tagliata and Tuscan fries, and a fiery egg dish designed for late-night parties.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades rescues a tired rocking chair, old scaffolding poles and a pair of dining chairs from the tip, enlisting Kev Paxton and Simion Hawton-Smith to help transform them.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton is tasked with helping a couple and their young sons to quit London and make a new life and home in Derbyshire, and spends time with an artisan knife-maker.(n)

programme.title: Hugh's Wild West
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates volunteers who help wildlife in the West Country, meeting a woman who has transformed her home into a hedgehog hospital.(n)

programme.title: Animals with Cameras
programme.desc: Gordon Buchanan and a team of scientists learn more about various species through the use of animal bodycams. In Namibia, they help conservationist Marlice van Vuuren find out whether the three orphaned cheetahs she has raised have developed the skills needed to hunt for themselves in the wild, with close-up footage revealing how the cats choose their prey. On Kanowna Island off the south coast of Australia, Gordon discovers how the fur seal population manages to thrive and hunt in the surrounding shark-infested waters, and in South Africa, cameras gives an insight into the lives of wild baboons.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti join the staff working in some of the most unusual hotels around the world, learning the tricks of the trade along the way. This time, Giles and Monica help out at The Torridon in the Scottish Highlands, Britain's most northerly five-star hotel. Its need to balance a luxury stay with being self-sufficient has Monica collecting seaweed for the kitchen and helping to herd Highland cattle, while Giles learns to change toilet seats and joins the staff in their afternoon off - for a swim in the beautiful but freezing-cold loch.(n)

programme.title: Inside Central Station
programme.desc: Music festival goers descend on Glasgow, a street art mystery is revealed, and the oldest and youngest train cleaners on the station set to work.(n)

programme.title: Gardening Together with Diarmuid Gavin
programme.desc: The horticultural designer encourages people across Ireland to get out in their gardens, taking calls, answering questions and offering a range of practical tips. He helps design a garden for Mary Fitzpatrick in Co Wicklow and creates a sunken fire pit and seating area in his own patch.(n)

programme.title: Our Farming Life
programme.desc: Through the experiences of Ulster-Scots farming families and stories of change, challenge and commitment, this series explores how farming in Ulster has evolved across the decades. This first episode visits three Ulster farms, including Cold Blow Farm in Ballynure, Co Antrim, to explore how small mixed farms began a process of change in the 1950s. Farmers featured include 81-year-old Richard Creith.(n)

programme.title: Test Cricket Highlights
programme.sub-title: Today at the Test: England v West Indies
programme.desc: Action from day two of the Third Test in the three-game series, held at Old Trafford. The Windies may still be a long way from reproducing the quality of their incredible teams of the 1970s and 80s, but their new pace attack has been heralded as one of the strongest in world cricket, and should provide a great test for the English batsmen, whose time at the crease of late has understandably been limited.(n)

programme.title: American History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: Lucy explores how American history has been mythologised and manipulated by generations of politicians, writers and protesters. She begins by examining the American Revolution - a David-and-Goliath battle of men with high ideals taking on the might of the British Empire. But how much of America's founding story is based on fact?(n)

programme.title: World Cup 1966: Alfie's Boys
programme.desc: David Jason presents a documentary about how Alf Ramsey recruited the England football team that won the world cup in 1966, and was able to unite the members into a world class side. Featuring archive footage of the team in action and contributions from Bobby Charlton, Jack Charlton, Jimmy Greaves, George Cohen, Tina Moore, Harry Redknapp, Terry Venables, Geoff Hurst and Gordon Banks.(n)

programme.title: Match of Their Day
programme.desc: A special episode of the programme dedicated to Jack Charlton, the World Cup winner and former Republic of Ireland manager, who died earlier this month at the age of 85.(n)

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: The first of three special editions of the archive music show focusing on hits from the 1960s, including songs by the Foundations, Julie Driscoll, Sandie Shaw and Procol Harum. Narrated by Mark Radcliffe.(n)

programme.title: Just Jim
programme.desc: A Welsh teenager leads a lonely life after being rejected by his only friend. He becomes fascinated by a mysterious American who moves in next door, and the new arrival offers him some advice on how to be cool. The youngster starts to develop the life he had always longed for, but begins to wonder if he was happier the way he used to be. Comedy drama, starring Emile Hirsch and Craig Roberts.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2020
programme.desc: A BBC Grand Virtual Orchestra made up of more than 300 BBC musicians perform Beethoveniana by composer Iain Farrington, a brand new reworking of Beethoven's nine symphonies commissioned by the BBC Proms to celebrate the opening of the 2020 Proms season.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms Classics
programme.desc: Katie Derham presents this 2017 concert by the City of Birmingham Symphony Orchestra, conducted by Mirga Grazinyte-Tyla. The show features Beethoven's Fifth Symphony, Stravinsky's Violin Concerto with soloist Leila Josefowicz, and a piece by Gerald Barry, featuring tenor Allan Clayton.(n)

programme.title: The Merchant of Venice: Royal Shakespeare Company
programme.desc: When a contract between Bassanio and Shylock is broken in Venice, simmering racial tensions boil over. A wronged father, and despised outsider, Shylock looks to exact the ultimate price for a deal sealed in blood. Polly Findlay directs this RSC production of Shakespeare's uncompromising play, with Makram J Khoury, Patsy Ferran and Jamie Ballard.(n)

programme.title: Institute
programme.desc: In a shadowy establishment, residents attempt to create order from the chaos of life. Carers become patients, memories fracture and relationships collide. Drama by the physical theatre company Gecko, starring Chris Evans and Vanessa Guevara Flores.(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare in Italy
programme.sub-title: Shakespeare in Italy with Francesco da Mosto
programme.desc: The historian concludes his tour of the country beginning with a visit to Venice, where he meets actor Ciaran Hinds to discuss why the Bard chose the city as the setting for The Merchant of Venice. Francesco is then joined by Mark Rylance in Rome as they explore how the playwright used the Italian capital for the plots of Julius Caesar and Antony and Cleopatra to avoid Elizabethan censors. Finally, on the island of Stromboli, off the northern coast of Sicily, Francesco uncovers the location for Shakespeare's late masterpiece - The Tempest.(n)

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe marks the final round of the FA Cup by providing football fans with a chance to revisit some of the best (and worst) songs produced to celebrate the tournament's conclusion over the years. Viewers at home will be able to make use of social media to vote for their favourite tunes, meaning that woeful ditties such as Manchester United's 1996 song Move Move Move, featuring a youthful Paul Scholes, David Beckham and the Neville brothers, could feature alongside the arguably more 'professional' sounding efforts of the London Community Gospel Choir, which sang Abide With Me - the FA Cup's traditional anthem - ahead of Chelsea's clash with Everton at Wembley in 2009.(n)

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Roxy struggles with her betrayal of Ronnie, Christian reaches breaking point with Steven, while Sean careers dangerously out of control.(n)

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey's search for Sean takes her to Tanya's doorstep, Ian sets out to bring Lucy home, and Steven makes a serious accusation.(n)

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Roxy turns to Christian for support, while Bianca strikes up a feud with the Masoods. Gus bids farewell to the Square, but not before gaining revenge on Sean.(n)

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian's investigations lead to the truth about Steven, and Bianca tries Ricky's patience by refusing to back down to Zainab's demands.(n)

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc: Paul Rose sets off on the walk of a lifetime - 630 miles of the South West Coast Path. The explorer hopes to discover wildlife, wild traditions and wild adventure at every turn.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints a wintry scene in which the glistening sun peeks through the trees to warm the cold day.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Antiques Roadshow's Paul Atterbury recalls the heyday of the great ocean liners, travelling round Britain to reveal a story of design, politics and tragedy as he finds out how these great ships captured the public's imagination. Along the way he uncovers a cinema in Scotland built from the interiors of the SS Homeric, and visits a house in Poole, Dorset, where cabins from the Mauretania have been preserved.(n)

programme.title: Being Beethoven
programme.desc: As the composer embarked on the extraordinary flowering of his late music, his health deteriorated and his desire for love and family tipped over into obsession. Musical highlights include Paul Lewis exploring the beauty and brutality of the Diabelli Variations, and the Takacs Quartet playing the Hymn of Thanksgiving from Op 132.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: The Black Forest to Hannover - Part Two
